@value.label: Hydr. cylinders stow to loading positioning

@id: 36 FREEZING, REFRIGERATING AND HEATING SYSTEMS FOR CARGO

@value.label: Freezing, refrigerating and heating systems for cargo
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). The system in subgroups include all associated systems components such as: - Pipes with bends, T-pieces, brackets, expansion arrangements, penetration pieces, safety and other valves, filters, insulation  and sheathing etc. - Air and drain pipes (for system components). - Fans, compressors, pumps with drive units and ejectors. - Evaporators, condensers, heat exchangers and loose tanks. - Local instruments and local regulating equipment (in the systems). - Local control (operating) equipment. - Protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds). - Fitted flanges for connection to systems and associated components. - Spare parts. All auxiliary systems (connected systems) end at the intake flange on the system described in the subgroup. For freezing, refrigerating and heating systems common for cargo and provisions, cargo is considered to be the main func- tion, and the common systems are charged the respective subgroups in ..... group 36
references: 36 FREEZING, REFRIGERATING AND HEATING SYSTEMS FOR CARGO
316 Protection Plates, Covers, Hatch Tents and Tarpaulins

@id: 361 Insulation and Sheathing of Cargo Holds/Tanks

@value.label: Insulation and sheathing of cargo holds/tanks
@value.definition: Insulation and sheathing of cargo holds and tanks (hull tanks and/or loose tanks) are freezing tunnel, including such as: - Framing with lugs or similar. - Insulation of tank top, bulkheads, side shell, underside of deck, loose tanks and of hatches, ports, manhole covers, etc. with coamings. - Condensate arresters and sheathing/lining for protection of the insulation. - Deck covering for protection of insulation. - Boundary bars for strip insulation.
references: 385 Insulation Drying System for Cargo Holds/Tanks
313 Loose Bulkheads for Cargo, Grain Feeders
555 Insulation, Lining and Battening in Provision Rooms, Doors and Ports
315 Deck/Hold Cargo Pillars, Bins, Shelves, Cases

@id: 362 Freezing and Refrigerating Systems for Dry Cargo

@value.label: Freezing and refrigerating systems for dry cargo
@value.definition: Freezing and refrigerating systems for dry cargo separately or common freezing and refrigerating system for dry cargo and provisions (e.g. fruit, vegetables, meat etc.), including such as: - Refrigeration machinery with compressors including drive units, condensers, evaporators, cooling batteries, oil sep- arators, driers, etc. - Circulation system (for brine, ammonia, Freon or similar) with circulation pumps, valves, insulation, pipes, etc. - Fans for circulation by/through cooling batteries. - Drip water trays with drain pipes. Also included here is the refrigeration machinery (which follows the ship) for containers, with connection hoses and asso- ciated machinery as stated above, together with refrigeration machinery for plate freezers, for freezing tunnel, for ice pro- duction and for RSW plant (Note! see also Ref.) with associated machinery as stated above.
references: 381 Sounding, Surveillance and Operating Equipment for Cargo Systems
384 Separate Cooling Water Systems for Cargo Equipment
371 Ventilation Systems for Refrigerated Cargo Holds
361 Insulation and Sheathing of Cargo Holds/Tanks

@id: 363 Direct Cooling Systems for Liquid Cargo

@value.label: Direct cooling systems for liquid cargo
@value.definition: Direct cooling systems (one or more stages) for recondensation of gas cargo, where the boil-off is extracted from the tanks, compressed and condensed directly by cooling water. The system includes such as: - Suction pipes from tanks or loading/discharging pipes with valves etc. - Fluid separators with return pump, piping, etc. - Compressors with drive units (low and high pressure compressors for multi-stage plant), filters, etc. - Medium pressure vessels with equipment (for multi-stage plant). - Fluid collectors. - Cargo condensers. - Return pipes for the condensed cargo to tanks or to the loading/discharging system. Also included here is the arrangement for lubricating the compressors, with equipment for oil regeneration. The cooling plant, or parts of it, can have subsidiary functions (but comes under this subgroup) and function as: - Pumps for cargo heating. - Producer of gas for transfer of cargo for discharging by means of pressure. If the above compressors are also used for compressing air, inert gas or for gas-freeing/unloading purposes, cooling is con- sidered to be the main function, and the compressors come under this subgroup.
references: 355 Loading/Discharging Systems for LPG/LNG in Gaseous Phase
384 Separate Cooling Water Systems for Cargo Equipment

@id: 364 Cascade Cooling Systems for Liquid Cargo

@value.label: Cascade cooling systems for liquid cargo
@value.definition: Cooling systems for recondensation of gas cargo, with two or more systems (primary and secondary) connected in cascade. In the first (primary) system, boil-off is extracted from the tanks, compressed, etc. in one or more stages and condensed against a boiling medium (Freon or similar). In the following (secondary) system(s), the boiling medium is extracted from the cargo condenser's secondary side, com- pressed in one or more stages and condensed finally by cooling water. The cascade system's primary part includes equipment as stated in subgroup 363. The cascade system's secondary part includes such as: - Suction pipes from the cargo condenser's fluid separator, with valves, etc. - Compressors with drive units (low and high pressure compressors for multi-stage plant), filters, etc. - Medium pressure vessels (for multi-stage plant). - Condenser (with cooling water). - Return piping for condensed cooling medium (Freon or similar) to cargo condenser, together with cross-connections, equipment for oil return, etc. Also included here is possible arrangement for lubrication of the compressors, with equipment for oil regeneration, together with bottles, pipes, etc. for replenishment of Freon or similar. The cooling plant, or parts of it, can have subsidiary functions (but comes under this subgroup) and function as: - Heat pump for heating of for example, dp-cells, sumps and auxiliary tanks (Note! see also Ref.). If the above compressors are also used for compressing air, inert gas or gas for gas-freeing/unloading purposes, cooling is considered to be the main function, and the compressors come under this subgroup.
references: 355 Loading/Discharging Systems for LPG/LNG in Gaseous Phase
365 Indirect Cooling/Heating Systems, Cargo Oil Heating
384 Separate Cooling Water Systems for Cargo Equipment

@id: 365 Indirect Cooling/Heating Systems, Cargo Oil Heating

@value.label: Indirect cooling/heating systems, cargo oil heating
@value.definition: Indirect cooling systems for liquid cargo, where the cooling medium Freon, brine or similar is circulated through pipes in the tanks and possibly around these. Also included here are indirect cooling/heating systems where the pipes in/on the tanks are also connected to a heating plant which is used, for example, when liquid cargo requiring heating is carried instead of liquefied gas. The system includes such as: - Piping in/around the tanks and to the cooling plant (Note! see also Ref.). - Separate cooling plant. - Heating plant with piping and valves, etc. from the pipes in/around the tanks, etc. to separate heat exchangers (with for instance steam), including these, and return piping to the tanks. Heating system for cargo holds and/or tanks, including the following categories of systems and equipment: - Heating coils in cargo oil tanks or tanks for other liquid cargo, including piping in (around) the tanks and possible con- nections between tanks, (Note! see also Ref.). - If heating of the cargo tanks takes place in two stages, i.e., when steam (or similar) is lead from the ship's main sys- tems to a heat exchanger in a closed system which only supplies the heating coils in the tanks, the closed system with heat exchanger and coils in the tanks are to be charged this subgroup (see also Ref.). Also included here are radiators with connecting pipes (heated with water, steam or chemical heat transfer fluid) in the cargo holds (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 374 Vent./Gas Freeing Systems for Tanks, Wind Sails with Equipment
75 STEAM, CONDENSATE AND FEED WATER SYSTEMS
36 FREEZING, REFRIGERATING AND HEATING SYSTEMS FOR CARGO

@id: 371 Ventilation Systems for Refrigerated Cargo Holds

@value.label: Ventilation systems for refrigerated cargo holds
@value.definition: Ventilation system with mechanical or natural circulation, for refrigerated cargo holds, including such as: - Make-up air plant and air circulation plant with air ducts, duct insulation, intake jealousies, etc. - Ventilation fans with drive units (see also Ref.). - Equipment for regulating air humidity, i.e. by means of absorption and similar. - Ozone plant for ventilation/air conditioning of the holds.
references: 381 Sounding, Surveillance and Operating Equipment for Cargo Systems
385 Insulation Drying System for Cargo Holds/Tanks
362 Freezing and Refrigerating Systems for Dry Cargo

@id: 371003 Make-Up Air Fans with Drive Units

@value.label: Make-up air fans with drive units

@id: 372 Closed Ventilation/Return Vapour Systems for Cargo Holds

@value.label: Closed ventilation/return vapour systems for cargo holds
@value.definition: Closed, mechanical ventilation system for non-refrigerated cargo holds where the cargo hold air is recirculated (closed sys- tem), and a controlled amount of fresh air can be added. The ventilation system includes such as: - Make-up air plant and air circulation plant with ducts, etc. - Ventilation fans with drive units. - Equipment for regulating air humidity, i.e. by means of  absorption, cooling or similar. - Heating batteries in the ventilation plant (see also Ref.). - Possible Ozone plant.
references: 373 Open Ventilation Systems for Cargo Holds
575 Ventilation/Air Conditioning Systems for Pump Rooms

@id: 373 Open Ventilation Systems for Cargo Holds

@value.label: Open ventilation systems for cargo holds
@value.definition: Open ventilation system for non-refrigerated cargo holds, also for spaces surrounding loose gas tanks, where the air is sup- plied and removed without recirculation. The following categories of equipment/plants are included: - Ventilation pipes with rotating cowls for natural ventilation. - Ventilation pipes with fans for mechanical ventilation. - Ventilation system with mechanical supply/removal of the air and distribution/removal ducts in the cargo holds, includ- ing fans, heating batteries and similar in connection with this (see also Ref.).
references: 375 Blow-Off System from Safety Valves (Pressure/Vacuum Valves)
372 Closed Ventilation/Return Vapour Systems for Cargo Holds

@id: 374 Vent./Gas Freeing Systems for Tanks, Wind Sails with Equipment

@value.label: Vent./gas freeing systems for tanks, wind sails with equipment
@value.definition: Systems and equipment for ventilation and gas freeing of cargo tanks and ballast/cargo tanks, including such as: - Portable ventilators with associated equipment. - Fixed pressure/vacuum fans (ejectors) with possible ducts, pipes, etc. for ventilation (see also Ref.).

@id: 375 Blow-Off System from Safety Valves (Pressure/Vacuum Valves)

@value.label: Blow-off system from safety valves (pressure/vacuum valves)
@value.definition: System for blow-off of tanks for cargo oil and other liquid cargo. This can also have additional functions such as: - Gas freeing and removal of steam (by means of ejectors fitted in the system). - Supply of air during discharging. - Removal of air/gas during loading. - Supply and removal of inert gas. The system includes such as: - Pressure/vacuum valves on tanks or tank hatches. - Piping from pressure/vacuum valves over the deck and up in masts or similar, with closing valves, possibly mounted ejector for gas freeing, flame arresters/shields, etc. - Separate masts which solely have to serve this function. - Arrangement for gas pressure gauges, including these, on/near the bridge, where these are placed (on a branch line) in the blow-off line.(Note! see also Ref.). For gas ships an equivalent arrangement for blow-off from safety valves on tanks, from spaces surrounding tanks and from safety valves in the systems (for cargo) is included here, with such as: - Safety valves on tanks and spaces surrounding tanks, and pressure membranes for these spaces (Note! see also Ref.). - Piping with valves, etc., from safety valves up to masts, or similar with flame arresters/shields, etc. - Separate masts which solely have to serve this function, with possible ventilation fans and similar equipment.
references: 374 Vent./Gas Freeing Systems for Tanks, Wind Sails with Equipment
375 Blow-Off System from Safety Valves (Pressure/Vacuum Valves)
381 Sounding, Surveillance and Operating Equipment for Cargo Systems
75 STEAM, CONDENSATE AND FEED WATER SYSTEMS
376 Inert Gas Systems with Conditioning Plant

@id: 376 Inert Gas Systems with Conditioning Plant

@value.label: Inert gas systems with conditioning plant
@value.definition: System for conditioning and supplying of inert gas to tanks for liquid cargo, to spaces in connection with this cargo and pos- sibly to cargo holds to prevent oxidation of the cargo, including the following types of systems: Inert gas system, where exhaust gas is taken from the funnel, or similar, including such as: - Conditioning plant with gas washers, driers, absorbers and similar. - Suction/pressure fans with drive units. - Ducts/pipes with valves, insulation, etc. from the funnel or similar, to the above mentioned components, to the cargo tanks or to loading/discharging pipes (see also Ref.). Inert gas system with own gas production plant, including such as: - Gas production plant with gas generators for burning of oil, or with transformers, condensers, loose storage tanks, etc. for chemical production of gas. - Separate fuel oil system for gas generators, with pipes, pumps, storage tanks, etc. (see also Ref.). - Conditioning plant with gas washers, driers, absorbers, heaters, etc., possibly with own cooling plant. - Ducts/pipes from the above components to the cargo tanks or loading/discharging pipes (see also Ref.). If the gas washers have a separate water supply system with own pump, etc.,this also comes under this subgroup.
references: 374 Vent./Gas Freeing Systems for Tanks, Wind Sails with Equipment
375 Blow-Off System from Safety Valves (Pressure/Vacuum Valves)
376 Inert Gas Systems with Conditioning Plant
663 Gas Turbo Aggregates for Electric Power Production

The systems in the subgroups also include all associated system components, such as: - Pipes with bends, T-pieces, brackets, expansion arrangements, penetration pieces, etc. - Pumps and fans with drive units and ejectors. - Local instruments and local regulating equipment (in the systems). - Local control (operating) equipment. - Protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds). - Fitted flanges for connection to systems and associated components. - Spare parts. @id: 381 Sounding, Surveillance and Operating Equipment for Cargo Systems

@value.label: Sounding, surveillance and operating equipment for cargo systems
@value.definition: Arrangement (systems) and equipment for sounding, control (supervision/monitoring) and operating control for systems in primary group 3, included such as: - Local sounding apparatus for cargo tanks with local reading and/or equipment for remote sounding of cargo tanks (pos- sibly also of other tanks where these are sounded remotely in an integrated system together with the cargo tanks), with transmission lines and measuring instruments (ullage and fluid level measurements). Here is also included com- bined arrangement for measuring draft and remote level sounding of cargo tanks and possibly other tanks. - Local instruments and indicating equipment (which is not fitted in the systems), for instance thermometers, mano- meters, hydrometers, O2 meters, gas indicators, oxygen indicators, etc. (gas measuring instruments). - Arrangement for remotely indicating and registering of the above mentioned and of status parameters in the systems and system components such as loading/discharging pumps, compressors, fans, etc. - Also included here are sensors, transmission lines and measuring instruments, together with data logger for cargo (Note! see also Ref.). - Spindle extensions for valves in the loading/discharging system and possibly other cargo systems. Also included are hydraulic oil systems or similar for remote control of valves in the loading/discharging system and possibly in other cargo systems (together with possibly other systems, for example ballast and other sea water systems where the valves in these are remotely controlled by an integrated system together with valves in the cargo systems). Also included here are machinery, tanks, transmission lines, etc. for the remote control function (Note! see also Ref.). - Equipment for remote control (and programmed control) and checking of loading/discharging pumps, compressors, fans and other components in the cargo systems, with transmission lines, etc. - Control consoles and panels, lockers, etc., for the installation of above automation equipment for cargo, with signs, con- nection materials, instruments, heating elements and similar against condensation, etc. - Separate EDP plant for above functions for cargo, with associated equipment as described under subgroup 423. The subgroup includes mechanical, electrical, hydraulic and/or pneumatic equipment and systems, or combinations of these, for the above functions, together with separate equipment for adjusting (regulation), protection and alarm in con- nection with the above.
references: 375 Blow-Off System from Safety Valves (Pressure/Vacuum Valves)
311 Loose Decks and Platforms for Cargo, Ramps

@id: 381071 Hydr. Oil Pumps with Drive Units

@value.label: Hydr. oil pumps with drive units
Tank cleaning systems and equipment
@value.definition: System for washing down and cleaning of cargo tanks (Butterworth system), including such as: - Suction and pressure pipes with valves, etc. to the tanks. - Pumps with drive units (see also Ref.). - Water preheaters and possibly separate drain coolers. - Washing machines. Where portable cleaning/washing machines which are connected to the fire and wash down piping are used, only the clean- ing/washing machines and connecting hoses are to be charged this subgroup. If the tank cleaning system has piping common with the loadig/discharging system, only the piping that has solely tank cleaning function is to be charged this subgroup. Equipment for cleaning cargo tanks, skimming equipment, equipment for adding neutralizing agents, washing and fat- decomposing substances for cargo tank cleaning. Similar and other equipment on board bulk carriers for washing down and cleaning cargo holds are also included here. Here is also included equipment for collection/destruction of oil spills on deck/on the sea, e.g. oil boom, equipment for chemical additives or similar.
references: 304 Smaller Hatches, Grain Hatches, Manhole Covers
813 Fire/Wash Down System, Emergency Fire Pumps, Sprinkler System

@id: 382044 Sampling Pump for Oil Spill Monitoring

@value.label: Sampling pump for oil spill monitoring
Lifting gear for cargo hoses
@value.definition: Equipment for handling cargo hoses during loading/discharging, including such as: - Cranes, alternatively masts/derrick booms or davits, with associated winches, rigging, derrick posts, fittings, etc. If the lifting equipment for cargo hoses is also used handling other goods, i.e. dry cargo, machinery components, provisions, etc. the lifting equipment is to be charged the subgroup that determines its lifting capacity (see also Ref.).
references: 45 LIFTING AND TRANSPORT EQUIPMENT FOR MACHINERY COMPONENTS
34 MASTS, DERRICK POSTS, RIGGING AND WINCHES FOR CARGO

@id: 384 Separate Cooling Water Systems for Cargo Equipment

@value.label: Separate cooling water systems for cargo equipment
@value.definition: Separate cooling water system for cargo equipment, e.g. for supply to condensers in cargo refrigeration plant (Note! see also Ref.). The system includes such as: - Suction, pressure and return pipes with valves, filters, etc. - Pumps with drive units, etc. - Possible loose tanks. If the separate cooling water system has secondary functions, e.g. supply of water to heat exchangers for heating of LPG, de-icing of refrigerating system, etc, the supply lines are to be charged this subgroup (Note! see also Ref.). Cooling/heating system (e.g. with water/glycol) for compressors, dp-cells etc. and RSW plant (sea water part, with pipes, pumps with drive units, valves, loose tanks, etc.) are also included here. (See also Ref.).

@id: 384004 Cooling Water Pumps with Drive Units

@value.label: Cooling water pumps with drive units

@id: 385 Insulation Drying System for Cargo Holds/Tanks

@value.label: Insulation drying system for cargo holds/tanks
@value.definition: Drying system for insulation in refrigerated compartments or on tanks for cargo, e.g. by means of dry air, including such as: - Ducts and pipes with valves, etc. - Fans with drive units. - Dehydrator, etc.
references: 557 Insulation Drying Systems for Provision Rooms
361 Insulation and Sheathing of Cargo Holds/Tanks

@id: 386 Equipment for Addition of Preservatives, Inhibitors, Spirits

@value.label: Equipment for addition of preservatives, inhibitors, spirits
@value.definition: Equipment/systems for adding to cargo substances such as: - Preservatives like formalin etc. - Smelling substances. - Inhibitors. - Ice. - Spirits, etc. Included here are pipes, loose tanks, valves, pumps with drive units, dosing apparatus, etc.
references: 36 FREEZING, REFRIGERATING AND HEATING SYSTEMS FOR CARGO

@id: 387 Special Structures for Loading/Discharging Over Stern/Stem

@value.label: Special structures for loading/discharging over stern/stem
@value.definition: Special structures for loading/discharging of for example oil, gas, etc. over stern and/or stem, including such as: - Platform construction with deck plating, stiffening, supports, stays, etc. - Railings, ladders, deck covering on/for the platform construction, together with other equipment which is solely for this (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 535 Fore and Aft Gangways with Equipment
387 Special Structures for Loading/Discharging Over Stern/Stem
53 EXT. DECK COVERING, LADDERS, STEPS, FORE AND AFT GANGWAY
893 Electric Lighting Systems for Deck and Cargo Holds

@value.label: Ship equipment
@value.definition: Ship specific equipment- and machinery. Navigational equipment, manoeuvring machinery, anchoring equipment, and communication equipment. This group also includes special equipment such as equipment for fishing.

@value.label: Manoeuvring machinery and equipment
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment (Note! special rules for subgroup 401). Also included in the subgroups are: - Pipelines with fittings for separate machinery. - Separate machinery i.e. hydraulic motors or similar, pumps with drive units, valves, loose tanks, etc. - Instruments, regulating and control (operating) equipment. - Protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds). - Fitted flanges for connection to systems and associated components. - Spare parts.
references: 448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables
639 Foils, Sails with Masts and Rigging

@value.label: Rudder with welded parts
@value.definition: Prefabrication/purchasing of rudder(s) including flaps with hinges (see also (Ref.), or movable nozzles which act as rud- ders, with welded-in parts (e.g. nozzle), including machine work done in the workshops and internal protection of the rud- der.
references: 402 Rudder Carriers, Rudder Stocks, Rudder Bearings
271 Bottom, Boot Top, Rudder, Rudder Trunk
278 External Cathodic Protection and Antifouling System
403 Steering Gear/Columns, Telemoter, Rudder Indicator, Emergency Steering

@id: 402 Rudder Carriers, Rudder Stocks, Rudder Bearings

@value.label: Rudder carriers, rudder stocks, rudder bearings
@value.definition: Mounting of rudders. Rudder equipment (purchases/prefabrication and mounting) including such as: - Rudder stocks, axles and pintles with liners and bolts, including securing devices, e.g. by casting. - Journal bearings, thrust bearings and rudder carrier with bearing (separate). - Liners in stern section/stern/heel boss etc. - Rudder stuffing boxes, drain plugs. - Equipment for lubrication of rudder bearings. - Lifting-eyes for mounting of rudder or for joint mounting of rudder and propeller. - Propellers with drive units for active rudder, alternatively driving gear (e.g. excenter) for rudder flaps, mounted to rud- der shaft (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 403 Steering Gear/Columns, Telemoter, Rudder Indicator, Emergency Steering

@id: 403 Steering Gear/Columns, Telemoter, Rudder Indicator, Emergency Steering

@value.label: Steering gear/columns, telemoter, rudder indicator, emergency steering
@value.definition: Steering plants, including such as: - Steering gear with associated pumps, electric motors, pipes with valves etc., storage tanks, connections to rudder stocks, etc. - Here is also included separate steering gear for rudder flaps with similar equipment. - Steering columns with connections to steering gear (and possibly to active rudders) of electric, hydraulic (telemotor sys- tems) and/or pneumatic type, or a combination of these, complete with all system components. - Rudder indicators with associated equipment (transmissions etc.). - Equipment for remote start/stop of steering gear and other machinery in connection to steering gear (Note! see also Ref.). - Separate plans for emergency steering, including connections to steering gear/rudder stock.
references: 403 Steering Gear/Columns, Telemoter, Rudder Indicator, Emergency Steering
793 Automation Equipment, Prop. Machinery and Transmission, Engine Telegraph

@id: 403006 Hydr. Oil Pumps with Drive Units

@value.label: Hydr. oil pumps with drive units
Side thrusters
@value.definition: Propeller plants forward and/or aft mainly for manoeuvring of the vessel (side or bow thrusters/steering pro- pellers/transverse propellers) including such as: - Propellers. - Propeller drive units (i.e. electric, hydraulic or diesel engines). - Power transmissions and possibly separate hydraulic pipelines with associated pumps, valves, etc. - Manoeuvring and control plants. - Tunnels (ducts) and nozzles with gratings (grids), etc.

@id: 404012 Transverse Propeller Grating and Protective Screens

@value.label: Transverse propeller grating and protective screens

@id: 404031 Hydr. Oil Pumps with Drive Units

@value.label: Hydr. oil pumps with drive units
Stabilizers
@value.definition: Mechanical or fluid stabilizers for the ship, against inclinations/rolling, heeling and/or trimming, including such as: - Stabilizing fins with hull recesses (penetrations), alternatively fluid stabilizing system with tanks, casings and double bottom tunnel, etc. - Machinery, such as pumps with drive units, valves, etc. - Control and regulating equipment. - Liquid stabilizers including additional equipment (see also Ref.) such as piping, nozzles, valves, possible loose tanks, etc., remote sounding of fluid tanks and patent/design expenses, and possible separate auxiliary systems.
references: 285 Ballast, SW and Stability Tanks, Cofferdams, Chain Lockers
264 Fender and Wear Bars, Ice Fins, Bilge Keels, Air Cushion Arr.

@value.label: Brakes
@value.definition: Brakes to stop ship/propulsion plant, including such as: - Brakes on propeller shafts/intermediate shafts with associated equipment. - Brakes (flaps) penetrating the shell, with recesses, bearings, moving mechanisms, operating and control equipment. Water parachutes or similar.
references: 621 Gas Turbines with Air Preheaters for Propulsion

@value.label: Bubble plants
@value.definition: Bubble plant, primarily for steering and manoeuvring of the ship in ice, including such as: - Air production plant with compressors, including drive units, oil/water separators, coolers, etc. - Also included here are separate systems for the compressor/drive unit, such as exhaust gas system, lube oil system, fuel oil system, cooling water system, etc., with all system components (pumps, pipes, valves, etc.). - Air intake system, including pipes/ducts, with bends, flanges, valves, silences, nozzles, etc. - Equipment for remote start/stop, control and supervision (monitoring).
references: 576 Ventilation/Air Cond. Systems for Steering Gear Compartments
715 LO System for Gas Gen., Common LO System for Other Machinery

@value.label: Dynamic positioning (dp) systems
@value.definition: System for dynamic positioning of ship (e.g. drilling vessel) including such as: - Position reference system with wire, lead, clinometers, separate. - Constant tension winch etc.

@id: 408033 Network, Stationary DP, Vessel System, Station System (SDP, SVS, SSS)

@value.label: Network, stationary dp, vessel system, station system (sdp, svs, sss)
Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Navigation and searching equipment
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). Also included in the subgroups are: - Pipes with bends, T-pieces, etc., cables for transmission of signals, cable clamps, fittings, penetration pieces, filters, switches, transformers, junction boxes, electric instruments, etc. - Aerials. - Control (operating) equipment. - Protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds).

@value.label: Radar plants
@value.definition: Radar plants for navigation and searching, also including radar plants for military purposes, comprising such as: - Transmitters/receivers. - Aerials. - Indicators. - Transformers, converters, junction boxes, etc. - Anti-collision plants (separate). - Associated equipment for plotting (plotting tables etc.) direction finding equipment, etc., including equipment for mil- itary purposes, such as radar identification systems, shooting radars, etc.
references: 414 Underwater Searching Equipment, ASDIC, Echo Sounder, Speed Log
418 Radar, Signal, Observation and Antenna Masts

@value.label: Position and identification systems
@value.definition: Navigation plants of the following categories: - GPS, DGPS, AIS, Seatex. - Loran, Omega, Console plants, etc. - Equipment/plants for satellite, doppler and/or inertia navigation. - Radio direction finder system/directional radio beacon, and radio beacon e.g. for drilling vessel. The plants include such as: - Receivers/transmitters. - Aerials. - Indicators. - Transformers, converters, junction boxes, etc. - Associated equipment, such as track (position) recorders, etc. - Signal transmission cables.

@value.label: Gyro plants, autopilots, compasses
@value.definition: Navigation/manoeuvring equipment of the following categories: - Gyro plants with gyro, gyro compasses, gyro direction finders (repeater), turning rate indicator, alarms, autopilots, pos- sible converters, etc., and connections/transmissions to the steering gear, etc. - Other compasses with autopilots, etc. - Standard compasses (other compasses). This group also includes additional equipment, e.g. position and course recorders, course deviation alarm, etc.
references: 403 Steering Gear/Columns, Telemoter, Rudder Indicator, Emergency Steering

@id: 414 Underwater Searching Equipment, ASDIC, Echo Sounder, Speed Log

@value.label: Underwater searching equipment, asdic, echo sounder, speed log
@value.definition: Plants and equipment for underwater searching, also for fishing vessels and naval vessels, and for determination of bottom conditions, water temperature, depth, speed and distance, including such as: - Echo sounders. - ASDIC/sonar. - Fish magnifier/observer, underwater T.V., net-sensor etc. - Handled with rope, including platform, outrigger, etc. - Log to measure speed and distances (electro-magnetic-, doppler-, patent- and hand logs, etc.) with bottom installation and transmissions. The plants include: - Transmitters/receivers. - Underwater domes/trunks. - Winches for drawing of net transmitter and other instruments, e.g. in connection with searching for fish, e.g. net sounder winch (cable winch) with drive unit. - Equivalent equipment as mentioned in subgroup 412.

@value.label: Electronic charting
@value.definition: ECDIS equipment including: - Display. - Processor. - Keyboard. - Hull stress monitors.

@value.label: Navigation tv
@value.definition: Television equipment for navigational purposes (e.g. mounted on bow), complete with all components, transmission cables, etc. Periscopes are also included here and equipment to take thermal pictures in order to ease navigation, manoeuvring etc.
references: 792 Common Automation Equipment, Engine Room Alarm Systems

@id: 417 Nautical Utility Equipment, Clockworks, Weather Facsimile

@value.label: Nautical utility equipment, clockworks, weather facsimile
@value.definition: Miscellaneous nautical auxiliary equipment and other equipment (mainly used in connection with navigation), including such as: - Clocks, chronometers, master clock systems with master clock, satellite clocks, transmissions, etc. - Weather chart recorder (facsimile equipment for transmitting of weather chart, weather prognoses and wave chart and possible documents and similar) with receiver and possible transmitter and connections and coupled equipment. Here is also included receiver for weather and navigation notices/alarms/warnings. - Sextant, octants, azimuth apparatus, pelorus, magnifying glasses, binoculars, etc. - Course pointers. - Pair of compasses, rulers, planimeters, integrators, etc. - Charts. - Thermometers (also in cabins, engine rooms, etc.), barometers, hygrometers, wind gauges, wave gauges (direction and speed, etc.) - (See also Ref.).
references: 414 Underwater Searching Equipment, ASDIC, Echo Sounder, Speed Log
381 Sounding, Surveillance and Operating Equipment for Cargo Systems

@id: 418 Radar, Signal, Observation and Antenna Masts

@value.label: Radar, signal, observation and antenna masts
@value.definition: Radar and signal masts, observation masts or other masts for support of antennas (aerials) and signal equipment (see also Ref.), with items such as: - Rigging with fittings (fixtures). - Lantern screens. - Ladders, railings and possible crow's nest. - Grounding (earthling) wires with plates.
references: 427 Light and Signal Equipment, Lanterns, Typhoons

@value.label: Integrated navigation systems
@value.definition: Integrated navigation and search systems, also for military purposes, including such as: - Consoles. - Screens. - Indicators. - Transformers, converters, switchgear etc. - Connected equipment for plotting (plotting table etc), taking bearings etc.
references: 414 Underwater Searching Equipment, ASDIC, Echo Sounder, Speed Log
418 Radar, Signal, Observation and Antenna Masts
403 Steering Gear/Columns, Telemoter, Rudder Indicator, Emergency Steering

@value.label: Communication equipment
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). Also included in the subgroups are: - Cables between system components for signal transmission with fittings, penetration pieces, switches, converters, elec- trical instruments, junction boxes, etc. - Aerials. - Control (operating) equipment. - Protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds). - Spare parts. - Special equipment for testing, adjusting and repair of the plant.
references: 418 Radar, Signal, Observation and Antenna Masts
882 Cable Trays with Installation in Accommodation
448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables

@value.label: Gmdss system
@value.definition: GMDSS system for external communication (main and stand-by installations) including such as: - Consoles, transmitters/receivers, inmarsat-C, batteries.

@id: 421004 GMDSS Medium Frequency/High Frequency Single Side Band (MF/HF SSB)

@id: 421009 GMDSS Narrow Band Direct Printing (NBDP) Telex Terminal

Lifeboat radio transmitters, epirb/sart
@value.definition: Communication equipment, primarily for emergencies, including such as: - Portable radio equipment (lifeboat transmitter) with equipment and fixtures. - Emergency radio direction finder transmitters and emergency communication sets (VHF) with fixtures. - Antenna for lifeboats. - Permanent radio-telegraph installation for lifeboats. - Direct current transformer, loading rectifier for lifeboats.

@id: 422005 VHF Emergency Position Indicating Radio Beacons (EPIRB)

@value.label: Vhf emergency position indicating radio beacons (epirb)
Satellite communication, data transmission plants
@value.definition: Plant for external data transmission, such as: - Inmarsat-A, B, C, Mini-M, Iridium system, Fleet-33, 55, 77 - Wireless telephone, Cellular telephone, Network (LAN), Modems - EDP voyage recorders, Power converters, Power transformers - Inmarsat A, B, C - Mini-M - Iridium - Fleet 33, 55, 77 - Network General purpose EDP plants used for several purposes such as: - Collision warning. - Payroll calculations. - Loading calculations (distribution of cargo). - Condition control, general control and monitoring of machinery, etc. The EDP plants include such as:

@value.label: Vhf/uhf telephones
@value.definition: Telephone plants, mainly for external communication, which are not included in the subgroups 421 and 422, such as: - VHF, UHF and SHF telephone/radio, portable or stationary/mounted, primarily for maritime radio frequencies (not Walkie-Talkie, see Ref.). - Lake-telephone. - Equipment for satellite communication. - The plants include such as: - Transmitters/receivers. - Aerials. - Transformers, converters, junction boxes, batteries, signal transmission cables, etc. - Walkie-Talkie ("Citizen-band").

@id: 424001 VHF Radio Simplex Systems with Antenna

@value.label: Vhf radio simplex systems with antenna

@id: 424003 VHF Radio Duplex Systems with Antenna

@value.label: Vhf radio duplex systems with antenna

@id: 424024 VHF Selective Calling Receiver with Antenna

@id: 424052 Portable VHF/AM Aviation Frequency Radio Sets

@value.label: Portable vhf/am aviation frequency radio sets
Calling/command/crew call telephone plants, walkie-talkies
@value.definition: Electrical communication systems, mainly for internal communication, such as: - Calling systems. - Command telephones or combined command-/calling-/music plant  (see also Ref.). - Crew call systems (buzzer systems). - Telephone plants (including telephone boxes). - Walkie-talkies. The plant includes telephones, loud-speakers, switchboards, signal equipment, connecting cables and leads, separate con- verters, etc.
references: 427 Light and Signal Equipment, Lanterns, Typhoons
417 Nautical Utility Equipment, Clockworks, Weather Facsimile
793 Automation Equipment, Prop. Machinery and Transmission, Engine Telegraph
792 Common Automation Equipment, Engine Room Alarm Systems
811 Fire Detection, Fire and Lifeboat Alarm Systems
882 Cable Trays with Installation in Accommodation

@id: 425071 Public Address, Emergency, Alarm, Broadcast, Entertainment System

@value.label: Public address, emergency, alarm, broadcast, entertainment system
Speaking tubes, tube post plants
@value.definition: Intercommunication equipment, non-electrical, including such as: - Speaking tubes with whistles, spouts, tube fittings, etc. - Tube post plant (pneumatic plant for transmission of messages) with separate compressed air/vacuum plants, loose tanks, receiving/sending boxes, tube fittings, etc. - Communication hatch with fittings, etc. between bridge/radio room and/or chartroom.
references: 427 Light and Signal Equipment, Lanterns, Typhoons

@id: 427 Light and Signal Equipment, Lanterns, Typhoons

@value.label: Light and signal equipment, lanterns, typhoons
@value.definition: Light and signal equipment for normal communication, including such as: - Lanterns with lantern controllers. - Daylight signal lamps, aldis lamps, knife lamps, etc. - Signal lights with controllers, brackets and associated equipment. - Searchlight with davits, controllers and associated equipment for passage through Suez Canal, St. Lawrence Seaway, etc. - Equipment for floodlighting, edge marking and warning light for obstacles in connection with helicopter landing plat- form/cite. - Flags and flag equipment, flag- and jack-staffs complete (Note! see also Ref.). - Typhoons with water separating tanks and other equipment, fog horns, whistles, sirens, megaphones, ship's bell, gongs, etc. - Anchor balls, not under command (NUC) balls, Mena-cylinder, warning light for bulb. - Wind socks (cones).

893 Electric Lighting Systems for Deck and Cargo Holds

@value.label: Anchoring, mooring and towing equipment
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). Also included in the subgroups are: - Pipes with bends, T-pieces, fittings, etc., for separate machinery. - Separate machinery, i.e. hydraulic motors or similar, pumps with drive units, valves, loose tanks, etc. - Instruments, regulating and control (operating) equipment. - Fitted flanges for connection to systems and associated components. - Spare parts.

@value.label: Anchors with chains and equipment
@value.definition: The ship's anchor equipment, including such as: - Bow and/or stern anchors, plus sea and warping anchors. - Spare anchors with anchor davits and equipment (foundations). - Anchor chains with swivels, shackles, marks, fittings, etc. - Grating and ceiling in chain locker.
references: 427 Light and Signal Equipment, Lanterns, Typhoons
246 Bow and Stem Sections, Forebody Bulkheads

@value.label: Windlasses with chain stoppers, rollers
@value.definition: Windlasses with steam, hydraulic or electrical machinery, Including also:

@id: 433 Comb. Windlass/Mooring Winches with Chain Stoppers, Rollers

@value.label: Comb. windlass/mooring winches with chain stoppers, rollers
@value.definition: Windlasses with extra drums for mooring lines. Included are similar equipment/machinery as described in subgroup 432, with supplementary equipment for mooring pur- poses.

@value.label: Capstans, warping and mooring winches
@value.definition: Winches - vertical or horizontal - for warping (shifting) and mooring with steam, hydraulic or electrical machinery. Also included are: - Operating equipment (controllers), etc. - Equipment for self-tension. - If these winches are used for other purposes (functions), e.g. as cargo winches, their main function, i.e. the function that determines their lifting/pulling capacity, decides the subgroup they come under (see also Ref.).
references: 433 Comb. Windlass/Mooring Winches with Chain Stoppers, Rollers

@value.label: Fixed mooring equipment
@value.definition: Fixed mooring and warping (shifting) equipment, including such as: - Mooring pipes with covers, mooring cups, chocks, Panama chocks, etc. - Fairleads, vertical lead rollers. - Rollers. - Bollards, rotor bollards, etc.
references: 264 Fender and Wear Bars, Ice Fins, Bilge Keels, Air Cushion Arr.

@value.label: Loose mooring equipment
@value.definition: Loose mooring and warping (shifting) equipment, including such as:

@value.label: Towing equipment
@value.definition: Towing equipment for ordinary vessels, rescue ships, tugs, supply ships and similar, including such as: - Tow and fire wire/ropes (hawsers). - Towing brackets. - Hooks. - Rollers. - Towing winches with machinery, etc. (also towing-/anchor handling winches for supply ships). - Brackets and towing gallows. - Auxiliary equipment in connection with towing that cannot logically be included in other subgroups., e.g. for tug/supply ship equipment such as: Towing/hauling winches with possible separate hydraulic aggregate, alternatively cross bol- lards for towing. - Stern drum. - Storage drums with possible separate driving machinery for towing line/towing rope from other ship or own ropes in connection with towing.

@id: 438 Common Hydr. Oil System for Anchoring/Mooring Equipment

@value.label: Common hydr. oil system for anchoring/mooring equipment
@value.definition: Common hydraulic oil system for operation and control of winches/windlasses included in group 43, and smaller equip- ment/machinery that will not influence capacity requirements for the common hydraulic oil system. The system includes such as: - Pumps with drive units, automation equipment, etc. - Surge tanks and storage tanks with flanges and valves, etc. - (Note! see also Ref.). - Cooling arrangement in tanks or separate coolers. - Filling, sounding, drain and vent. pipes for tanks, etc. - Pipelines between these components and supply pipelines to winches, etc., including return. The system pipelines include all system components, such as bends, T-pieces, flanges, supports, expansion devices, pen- etration pieces, valves, filters, purification plant, taps, waste trays, etc. The subgroup also includes other common equipment for windlasses and mooring winches.
references: 309 Common Hydraulic Oil System for Hatches/Ports

@value.definition: 44.  Rep./Maint./Clean. Equip. Workshop/Store Outfit, Nameplates The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated:

@id: 441 Machine Tools, Cutting and Welding Equipment

@value.label: Machine tools, cutting and welding equipment
@value.definition: Machine tools (fixed/stationary), cutting and welding equipment, delivered with the ship for ordinary maintenance and repair onboard, including such as: - Lathes, milling machines, drilling machines, etc. - Planning machines, shaping machines, etc. - Units for electric welding. - Equipment for gas welding and cutting. - Tool steel and other accessories, and special lockers and similar, as e.g. lockers for welding electrodes and other spe- cial equipment for the above stated.
references: 446 Outfitting in Store Rooms and Workshops
505 Loose Firefighting Apparatuses and Equipment, Firemen's Outfit
504 Medical, First Aid and Dental Equipment, Medicines

@value.label: General hand and pneumatic tools
@value.definition: Tools and equipment for the engineers, other hand tools and special tools delivered with the vessel, including such as: - Hammers, sledge hammers, pliers, wrenches, screwdrivers, spanners, bolt-drivers, drifts, chisels, anvils, vices, drills, sol- dering torches, etc. - Emery wheels, grindstones and portable grinding machines, valve grinding machine and loose compressed air hoses with couplings. - Measuring instruments, calipers, etc.

@value.label: Painting equipment, scaffolding, paint rafts/boats (gigs)
@value.definition: Equipment delivered with the vessel for maintenance painting on board, with associated equipment, including such as: - Rust hammers, scrapers and beaters. - Sandblasting apparatus. - Paint rollers, brushes and spray guns. - Paint, varnish, etc., with associated cleaning compositions and thinners. - Scaffolding/platforms and ladders for painting- and other maintenance work, with fittings and associated equipment. - Paint rafts and/or boats (workboats/rafts, inspection boats, gigs) with equipment on board, and associated davits, winches, etc. - The rafts/boats are included even if used for ship inspection, small trips, etc.

@value.label: Cleaning equipment, garbage chutes
@value.definition: Equipment delivered with the vessel for ordinary cleaning on board, except equipment particularly for galley and laundry, including such as: - Buckets, scrubbers, swabs, brushes, sponges, rugs, mops with racks, etc. - Deck and hull cleaning machines, winch with equipment for cleaning. - Floor buffers, sweeping machines, vacuum cleaners, vacuum cleaner plants (complete). - Portable soot sweeping machines, cleaning apparatus for grown/blocked piping. - Soap, cotton, twist and soda boxes in engine room, etc. - Cleaning crates and cleaning plants for engine parts. - Evaporator plants for separation of cleaning liquids, with tanks, pipes etc. - Garbage crates with tipping device, etc. - Garbage chutes for mounting on bulwark, or built-in with valve in the shell  plating and not connected to destruction plant - (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 446 Outfitting in Store Rooms and Workshops
55 GALLEY/PANTRY EQUIPMENT, PROVISION PLANTS, LAUNDRY/IRONING EQUIPMENT
813 Fire/Wash Down System, Emergency Fire Pumps, Sprinkler System

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@id: 446 Outfitting in Store Rooms and Workshops

@value.label: Outfitting in store rooms and workshops
@value.definition: Outfitting in workshops and storage rooms (stores that are not meant for cargo or provisions) and special rooms not used for living areas, i.e., steering gear compartment, lamp rooms, compressor room, etc. The following are included: - Partitioning bulkheads/netting bulkheads and netting doors, possible paneling (see also Ref.). - Workbench/table (vice benches with vices). - Lockers. - Shelves. - Racks. - Tool boards, etc.
references: 226 Decks, Platforms, Bulkheads, and Hull Tanks Below First Deck
55 GALLEY/PANTRY EQUIPMENT, PROVISION PLANTS, LAUNDRY/IRONING EQUIPMENT
31 EQUIPMENT FOR CARGO IN HOLDS ON DECK

@value.label: Clamps/foundations for spare parts
@value.definition: Prefabrication and mounting of clamps and foundations for spare parts and fastening of the spare parts (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 223 Inner Bottom with Stiffening, Engine Foundations

@id: 448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables

@value.label: Nameplates/marking on machinery, equipment, pipes, cables
@value.definition: Name plates/signs/labels (marking) on such as: - Derricks, lifeboats, deck machinery. - System components and other machinery/equipment. - Pipelines, ducts and cables. - Bulkheads, doors, bunks, etc. in the accommodation. Included, also, are such as framing and mounting of arrangement drawings, instruction panels, information boards, sound- ing boards and similar.
references: 381 Sounding, Surveillance and Operating Equipment for Cargo Systems

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@id: 45 LIFTING AND TRANSPORT EQUIPMENT FOR MACHINERY COMPONENTS

@value.label: Lifting and transport equipment for machinery components
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). Also included in the subgroups are: - Instruments, regulating and control (operating) equipment. - Protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds). - Spare parts.
references: 56 TRANSPORT EQUIPMENT FOR CREW, PASSENGERS AND PROVISIONS

@value.label: Engine room lifts
@value.definition: Engine room lift (elevator), complete with car (gondola), doors and machinery.
references: 564 Shore Gangways with Davits, Landing Booms

@id: 452 Travelling Cranes and Lifting Gear in Engine Room

@value.label: Travelling cranes and lifting gear in engine room
@value.definition: Lifting and transport equipment for machinery components in the engine room, pump rooms and other rooms for machinery, including such as: - Travelling cranes, pulleys and similar, above/for main and auxiliary engines, gas bottles, separators, etc. - Equipment for withdrawal and lifting of propeller shaft, etc. - Trolleys, wagons, etc. for transport of machinery parts. Also included are drive unit, operating devices, crane girders, etc.
references: 304 Smaller Hatches, Grain Hatches, Manhole Covers

@id: 453 External Lifting Gear for Machinery Components

@value.label: External lifting gear for machinery components
@value.definition: Lifting and transport equipment on external decks for machinery components, including such as: - Cranes. - Masts and derrick with rigging, etc. (Note! See also Ref.). - Derricks booms, separate, or suspended to derrick post for cargo/cargo oil houses. - Winches, etc. If this lifting gear is also used for handling such as cargo hoses, dry cargo, provisions, etc., the main function, i.e. the func- tion that determines the lifting capacity, decides the subgroup it comes under (see also Ref.).
references: 34 MASTS, DERRICK POSTS, RIGGING AND WINCHES FOR CARGO
402 Rudder Carriers, Rudder Stocks, Rudder Bearings
56 TRANSPORT EQUIPMENT FOR CREW, PASSENGERS AND PROVISIONS

@id: 453047 Hydr. Oil Pumps with Drive Units

@value.label: Hydr. oil pumps with drive units
Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Hunting and fishing equipment
@value.definition: The group includes only equipment specific for hunting, fishing and associated processing, while standard equipment (equipment to be found in most vessels), is included in the respective subgroup in other groups according to the function (Note! see also Ref.). The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). Also included in the subgroups are: - Pipes and ducts with bends, T-pieces, suspensions etc. - Pumps with drive units etc. (e.g. for separate hydraulic oil system).

@value.label: Hunting equipment for whale, seal
@value.definition: Equipment for hunting whale, seal, bear, etc. with associated auxiliary equipment, including such as: - Whale gun with associated equipment and platform. - Harpoons with tails, hawsers, shackles etc. - Winding apparatus or equivalent for harpoon hawser. - Whale windlass with drive machinery etc. - Rifles, hooking spikes, mallets etc. - Flags etc. for whale marking. - Pulleys and wire for hauling in of hides.

@id: 462 Longlines with Equipment, Nets, Hand Fishing Equipment

@value.label: Longlines with equipment, nets, hand fishing equipment
@value.definition: Fishing equipment included associated auxiliary equipment, of the following types: - Longlines with buoys and anchoring, longline tubs, spooling gear, longline droppers/-rollers, combined longline baiting and dropper equipment, longline windlass with machinery, etc. and auto line equipment. - Equipment in connection to bait and baiting, such as longline bating equipment, bait tables etc. - Nets with balls and buoys, net stones, equipment for dropping/handling and storing of net with such as net hauler, nets, spare equipment, transport rollers with drive unit, seine tracks, tubs etc. and control and operating equipment for mentioned machinery. - Hand fishing equipment, such as hand lines, hand line apparatus, fishing rods, jigs (spoon hooks), etc. - Fish traps with/without baits, with buoys etc.

@id: 463 Purse Nets and Seine Equipment, Power Blocks

@value.label: Purse nets and seine equipment, power blocks
@value.definition: Purse nets and seine with associated equipment, including such as: - Purse nets/seine with floats, buoys and leads. - Seine tracks, seine bins. - Purse net lines, purse net rings, ring needles, etc. - Purse net winch, ring net winch and end wire winch with machinery, guide blocks, seine rollers etc. - Power blocks with separate gallows, machinery and associated equipment. - Seine gallows and derricks, purse net davits. - Bins integrated in the hull structure are charged to the subgroups of group 2 concerned.
references: 465 Fish Pumping Plants and Landing Equipment

@id: 463047 Hydr. Oil Pumps with Drive Units

@value.label: Hydr. oil pumps with drive units
Trawling equipment
@value.definition: Fishing equipment in connection with trawling, including such as: - Trawls with trawl doors, bobbins, telemeter blocks/trawl indicator and other associated equipment. - Danish seine with associated equipment, rope blocks. - Trawl gallows/-davits, steel wire drums, transport apparatus and trawl bins. - Trawl winches or combined trawl-/seine winch, auxiliary winches such as sweep line winch, Gilson winch, bobbing winch, outhaul winch, cod end winch, etc. with drive units, brakes, couplings, spooling (reeling) apparatus etc. - Trawl bollards. - Lead blocks and blocks in connection with the above stated. - Operation and control equipment for the winches.
references: 414 Underwater Searching Equipment, ASDIC, Echo Sounder, Speed Log
465 Fish Pumping Plants and Landing Equipment

@id: 464047 Hydr. Oil Pumps with Drive Units

@value.label: Hydr. oil pumps with drive units

@id: 465 Fish Pumping Plants and Landing Equipment

@value.label: Fish pumping plants and landing equipment
@value.definition: Auxiliary equipment for fishing such as: - Fish pumps with pipe suction heads, separate drive machinery, plus additional extra equipment such as filter chests, bins, etc. - Equipment for landing of fish (scoop nets, etc.). - Fish bin/-trunk/-silo for collection before the fish is transferred to treatment/cargo holds (see also Ref.). - Equipment for transportation to meal-/oil-/processing plant. - Discharging pump for fish with piping etc. to be charged to the subgroup in group 35 concerned.
references: 463 Purse Nets and Seine Equipment, Power Blocks
386 Equipment for Addition of Preservatives, Inhibitors, Spirits
384 Separate Cooling Water Systems for Cargo Equipment

@value.label: Special fishing equipment
@value.definition: Special hunting/fishing equipment that is not included in subgroups 461-465, including such as: - Light hunting equipment. - Electric fishing equipment, etc. Also included is auxiliary equipment in connection with fishing, which can not be included in other subgroups in group 46 and which have functions which can not be included in subgroups in other primary groups (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 414 Underwater Searching Equipment, ASDIC, Echo Sounder, Speed Log

@value.label: Armament, weapon and counter measures
@value.definition: The group includes only the particular naval equipment, while standard equipment (equipment to be found in most ves- sels), is included in the respective subgroup in other groups according to the function (Note! see also Ref.). The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). Also included in the subgroups are: - Instruments, regulating and control (operating) equipment. - Protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds). - Spare parts.
references: 414 Underwater Searching Equipment, ASDIC, Echo Sounder, Speed Log
504 Medical, First Aid and Dental Equipment, Medicines
881 Cable Trays and Installation in Engine and Boiler Rooms
792 Common Automation Equipment, Engine Room Alarm Systems
811 Fire Detection, Fire and Lifeboat Alarm Systems
31 EQUIPMENT FOR CARGO IN HOLDS ON DECK
448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables
813 Fire/Wash Down System, Emergency Fire Pumps, Sprinkler System

@id: 471 Hand Weapons, Light and Heavy Guns

@value.label: Hand weapons, light and heavy guns
@value.definition: Attack weapons of the following categories: - Hand weapons such as rifles, pistols, light machine guns, machine pistols, etc. - Light guns such as (heavy) machine guns, etc. with block. - Heavy guns (cannons), complete with drive system, including necessary transformers, converters, amplifiers, etc., con- trol equipment, safety devices, suspension of the gun, built-in charging arrangement, mounted aerials, shields, etc.
references: 75 STEAM, CONDENSATE AND FEED WATER SYSTEMS

@value.label: Rocket plants
@value.definition: Plants for launching of rockets - ballistic or steered (homing) – against surface and/or air targets. The plants include equivalent equipment as stated in subgroup 471.

@value.label: Torpedo plants
@value.definition: Torpedo guns/tubes for launching of ordinary torpedoes (not anti-submarine torpedo plants). The plants also include: - Control and safety equipment. - Associated extra equipment. - Additional equipment if the tubes are used for mine laying.

@value.label: Anti-submarine weapons
@value.definition: Weapons against submarines, including such as: - Anti-submarine rocket plants with equivalent equipment as stated in subgroup 472. - Anti-submarine torpedo plants with equivalent equipment as stated in subgroup 473. - Depth-charge plants with mine racks, mine droppers and associated equipment.
references: 414 Underwater Searching Equipment, ASDIC, Echo Sounder, Speed Log

@value.label: Mine laying equipment
@value.definition: Complete plant for laying down mines (against surface vessels) including such as: - Racks. - Drop apparatus. - Lashing devices and deck fittings. - Control and safety devices, etc.

@value.label: Mine sweeping equipment
@value.definition: Plants for sweeping of mines, including such as: Electro-static induction sweeping equipment for sweeping of acoustic, magnetic and pressure mines, complete with asso- ciated special aggregates, panels, cables, control equipment, lifting gear, lashing devices, deck fittings, etc. Sweeping equipment for anchored mines, complete with special winches and cranes, paravanes, wire, control equipment, lashing devices, deck fittings, etc.
references: 414 Underwater Searching Equipment, ASDIC, Echo Sounder, Speed Log

@value.label: De-gassing plants
@value.definition: Plant for de-gassing, including such as: - Cables with cable trays. - Converters and rectifiers. - Panels, junction boxes and lockers. - Control equipment, etc.

@id: 478 Torpedo Counter Measures, Smoke Generating Equipment

@value.label: Torpedo counter measures, smoke generating equipment
@value.definition: Plants for anti-torpedo action (i.e. Unifoxer or Fanfare) including cables, winches, control equipment, lashing devices, deck fittings, etc. Also included are plants for smoke generation, other equipment for weapon countermeasures that is not stated in above subgroups and other naval equipment that cannot be included in other subgroups.

@value.label: Weapon control systems
@value.definition: Including, tactical consoles, mine warning consoles, ROV consoles, etc.

@value.label: Special equipment
@value.definition: The group includes only the respective special equipment, while standard equipment (equipment to be found in most ves- sels) is included in the respective subgroup in other groups according to the function (Note! see also Ref.). The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). Also included: - Instruments, regulating and control (operating) equipment. - Protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds). - Spare parts.
references: 448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables

@value.label: Drilling equipment
@value.definition: Special equipment for drilling in the seabed, including such as: - Drilling rig. - Lifting and hoisting gear. - Drilling machinery. - Drill racks and drills. - Bottom trunks in hull for drilling operation. Extra equipment in connection with drilling that cannot naturally be included in other subgroups, is included here.
references: 44 REPAIR/MAINT./CLEAN. EQUIPMENT WORKSHOP/STORE OUTFIT, NAME PLATES

@value.label: Dredging equipment
@value.definition: Special equipment for dredging of the seabed, including such as: - Dredging plant, sand suction apparatus or similar, etc. Extra equipment in connection with dredging, that cannot naturally be included in other subgroups, is included here.
references: 414 Underwater Searching Equipment, ASDIC, Echo Sounder, Speed Log

@value.label: Diving equipment and oceanographic equipment
@value.definition: Special equipment of the following categories: - Diving equipment such as suits, air/oxygen-apparatus, diving bells, decompression chambers with equipment, special air supply machinery, special lifting gear, etc. Here is also included trunk (moon pool) for lowering of diving bell etc. - Oceanographic measuring equipment such as turning thermometers, current meter, water testing apparatus, seabed testing apparatus, salinometers, equipment for recording of wave and water movements, equipment for colour mark- ing of icebergs, etc. - Special meteorological instruments for measuring of temperature, pressure, wind direction and force, rain, evap- oration, sun, etc. (measurements for research purposes). - Special measuring equipment in connection with plankton and fish survey. - Special lifting gears for the above. - EDP-plant only for oceanographic research purpose with associated equipment.
references: 414 Underwater Searching Equipment, ASDIC, Echo Sounder, Speed Log
417 Nautical Utility Equipment, Clockworks, Weather Facsimile

@id: 483013 Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler/Doppler Velocity Log (ADCP/DVL)

@value.label: Acoustic doppler current profiler/doppler velocity log (adcp/dvl)
Laboratory equipment
@value.definition: Laboratory equipment for particular purposes, e.g. for oceanographic research vessels, hospital ships, etc.
references: 504 Medical, First Aid and Dental Equipment, Medicines

@value.label: Aircraft, helicopters
@value.definition: Aircraft and helicopters, e.g. for naval vessels. Included is also associated, separate, extra equipment e.g. charge trolley, overhauling equipment, test apparatus, etc. that is necessary for aircraft operation and maintenance.
references: 44 REPAIR/MAINT./CLEAN. EQUIPMENT WORKSHOP/STORE OUTFIT, NAME PLATES

@value.label: Aux. vessels
@value.definition: Special auxiliary vessels, except lifeboats and paint rafts, such as: - Dories, light (lamp) boats, headman boats, towing boats, etc., for hunting and fishing purposes. - Launches, pinnaces, etc. for naval vessels. Included is all equipment in these vessels, plus davits, winches, etc. and other equipment for the auxiliary vessels, that can- not naturally be included in other subgroups.

@value.label: De-icing equipment
@value.definition: De-icing equipment for external application, such as: - Decks, masts, cranes, superstructure, railing and other equipment on external decks. Included are electric, chemical and steam systems used for de-icing, glycol, salt, etc.

@value.label: Seismic equipment
@value.definition: Cannon and detection cables with equipment, cable reels, cable oil systems with pumps and separators, paravane systems with winches. Seismic compressed air system incl. compressors and compressor cooling systems. Seismic hydr. oil system. Cable laying equipment such as: - Linear cable engine (LCE) - Bow cable engine (BCE) - Drop-off hold back engine (DOHB) - Cable drum engine (CDE) - Movable diverter - Stern sheave - Stonker - A-frame - Measuring unit - Dyno assembly - Winches - Davits and the applicable hydraulics.

@value.label: Environmental protection system
@value.definition: Oil collection and destruction equipment for use in combating oil spills from vessels, etc. Included are skimmers, booms, hoses with reels, oil bags, dispersion equipment, spray booms, foam plants and chemicals, and separate power supply for the equipment.

@value.label: Fish processing equipment
@value.definition: Fish processing equipment. Included are raw material handling and various factories, such as, fillet, shrimp, surimi, shell and meal oil with all the applicable machinery.

@value.label: Raw material handling
@value.definition: Plant and equipment for reception of catch before processing, conveyor belts and chutes. Equipment for conservation of food in the production process (see also Ref.) Equipment for disposal of fish waste.
references: 51 INSULATION, PANELS, BULKHEADS, DOORS, SIDE SCUTTLES, SKYLIGHTS
362 Freezing and Refrigerating Systems for Dry Cargo
386 Equipment for Addition of Preservatives, Inhibitors, Spirits
361 Insulation and Sheathing of Cargo Holds/Tanks
384 Separate Cooling Water Systems for Cargo Equipment

@value.label: Fillet factories
@value.definition: Plant and equipment for processing of catch to food products, including such as: - Flaying and cutting equipment. - Equipment for draining of blood, cleaning, washing, etc. of fish etc. - Cutting and filleting machines. - Plate refrigerators with pressure feeders, equipment in the refrigeration tunnel, glazing equipment (Note! see also Ref.). - Canning plant. - Packing machines, pallet binders, equipment for weighing. - Buffer stores and outfitting e.g. shelves, workbenches, etc. in the factories. - Conveyor belts and chutes between the above stated components. - Equipment for preserving food products during the production process (Note! see also Ref.). - Equipment for dumping of fish remains.
references: 51 INSULATION, PANELS, BULKHEADS, DOORS, SIDE SCUTTLES, SKYLIGHTS
362 Freezing and Refrigerating Systems for Dry Cargo
386 Equipment for Addition of Preservatives, Inhibitors, Spirits
361 Insulation and Sheathing of Cargo Holds/Tanks
384 Separate Cooling Water Systems for Cargo Equipment

@value.label: Shrimp factories
@value.definition: Plant and equipment for processing of catch to food products, including such as: - Cleaning equipment. - Plate refrigerators with pressure feeders, equipment in the refrigeration tunnel, glazing equipment (see also Ref.). - Packing machines, pallet binders, equipment for weighing. - Equipment for carton production, carton transporters. - Buffer stores and outfitting e.g. shelves, workbenches, etc, in the factories. - Conveyor belts and chutes between the above stated components. - Equipment for preserving food products during the production process (see also Ref.). - Equipment for disposal of waste.
references: 361 Insulation and Sheathing of Cargo Holds/Tanks
362 Freezing and Refrigerating Systems for Dry Cargo

@value.label: Meal and oil factories
@value.definition: Extraction plant for hunting, including such as: - Meal plant with cutting devices, feeders, cookers, presses, driers, separators, desludgers, mills, buffer stores, por- tioning equipment, conveyor belts, etc. - Oil plants with softening tank, boiling plant, pipes, pumps with drive unit etc. - Guano grinder, bins, etc. Also included is associated auxiliary equipment, e.g. special outfitting in the holds for meal and oil plants.

@value.label: Surimi factories
@value.definition: Plant and equipment for processing of catch to food products, including such as: - Flaying and cutting equipment. - Equipment for draining off blood, cleaning, washing, etc. - Cutting and filleting machines. - Plate refrigerators with pressure feeders, equipment in the refrigeration tunnel, glazing equipment (see also Ref.).                                  - Surimi plant. - Canning plant. - Packing machines, pallet binders, equipment for weighing. - Equipment for carton production, carton transporters. - Buffer stores and outfitting e.g. shelves, workbenches, etc, in the factories. - Conveyor belts and chutes between the above stated components. - Equipment for preserving food products during the production process (see also Ref.). - Equipment for disposal of waste.
references: 51 INSULATION, PANELS, BULKHEADS, DOORS, SIDE SCUTTLES, SKYLIGHTS
362 Freezing and Refrigerating Systems for Dry Cargo
386 Equipment for Addition of Preservatives, Inhibitors, Spirits
361 Insulation and Sheathing of Cargo Holds/Tanks
384 Separate Cooling Water Systems for Cargo Equipment

@value.label: Shell factories
@value.definition: Plant and equipment for processing of catch to food products, including such as: - Cutting equipment. - Equipment for cleaning, washing, etc. - Plate refrigerators with pressure feeders, equipment in the refrigeration tunnel, glazing equipment (see also Ref.). - Shell plant. - Canning plant. - Packing machines, pallet binders, equipment for weighing. - Equipment for carton production, carton transporters. - Buffer stores and outfitting e.g. shelves, workbenches, etc, in the factories. - Conveyor belts and chutes between the above stated components. - Equipment for preserving food products during the production process (see also Ref.). - Equipment for disposal of waste.
references: 51 INSULATION, PANELS, BULKHEADS, DOORS, SIDE SCUTTLES, SKYLIGHTS
362 Freezing and Refrigerating Systems for Dry Cargo
386 Equipment for Addition of Preservatives, Inhibitors, Spirits
361 Insulation and Sheathing of Cargo Holds/Tanks
384 Separate Cooling Water Systems for Cargo Equipment

@value.label: Crew and passenger equipment
@value.definition: Equipment, machinery, systems etc. serving crew and passengers, for example lifesaving equipment, furniture, catering equipment and sanitary systems.

@id: 50 LIFESAVING, PROTECTION, MEDICAL AND SECURITY EQUIPMENT

@value.label: Lifesaving, protection, medical and security equipment
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). Also included in the subgroups are: - Instruments, regulating and control (operating) equipment. - Protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds). - Spare parts.
