448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables
81 FIRE AND LIFEBOAT ALARM, FIRE FIGHTING AND WASH DOWN SYSTEMS
316 Protection Plates, Covers, Hatch Tents and Tarpaulins

@value.label: Lifeboats with equipment
@value.definition: Rescue boats (lifeboats) also combined lifeboat/workboat, including all equipment on board, loose and fixed (Note! see also Ref.), together with equipment such as: - Davits with winches (also portable, air-driven winches with air hoses, etc.), slip apparatus and rigging for hoisting and lowering, together with lashing and falls. - Skates, crabs and lifeboat ladders. - Lifeboat covers (note! see also Ref.). Here is also included man-overboard-boat (M.O.B.) with similar equipment as mentioned above. Hyperbaric lifeboat.
references: 811 Fire Detection, Fire and Lifeboat Alarm Systems
448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables
733 General Purpose Air Systems for Deck (Low Pressure)
316 Protection Plates, Covers, Hatch Tents and Tarpaulins

@value.label: Liferafts with equipment
@value.definition: Liferafts with all equipment on board, loose and fixed, together with raft fasteners and corresp. equipment as mentioned in subgroup 501. Additionally this group covers the Marine Evacuation system.
references: 316 Protection Plates, Covers, Hatch Tents and Tarpaulins
448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables

@value.label: Lifesaving, safety and emergency equipment
@value.definition: Lifesaving equipment, safety equipment (see also Ref.) and emergency equipment (except lifeboats/rafts), including such as: - Life buoys, belts and jackets with cases and fasteners. - Rescue rifle (line throwing apparatus) and rescue stool with associated equipment. - Wave-dampening tank with piping. - Shoring equipment (against leakage, etc.) such as wooden pillars, wedges, tallow, etc. - Emergency signals, flare apparatus, rockets, rocket gun, etc.
references: 427 Light and Signal Equipment, Lanterns, Typhoons
505 Loose Firefighting Apparatuses and Equipment, Firemen's Outfit
315 Deck/Hold Cargo Pillars, Bins, Shelves, Cases

@id: 504 Medical, First Aid and Dental Equipment, Medicines

@value.label: Medical, first aid and dental equipment, medicines
@value.definition: Equipment of preventative and medical treatment nature, against injuries and illness, including such as: - Medical and dental equipment such as instruments and other loose equipment, stationary equipment such as dental chair, operation table, X-ray, heating cabinets and special inventory/equipment for doctor/dentist. - Medicines and first-aid equipment such as medical and first-aid cabinets, stretchers, respirators (oxygen therapy equip- ment), etc. - Protection equipment such as helmets, ear-protection, safety-belts, work gloves, work shoes, goggles, etc.
references: 505 Loose Firefighting Apparatuses and Equipment, Firemen's Outfit

@id: 505 Loose Firefighting Apparatuses and Equipment, Firemen's Outfit

@value.label: Loose firefighting apparatuses and equipment, firemen's outfit
@value.definition: Fire extinguishing apparatuses and firefighting equipment, together with firemen's clothing and auxiliary equipment, including such as: - Portable fire extinguishers with CO2, powder, foam, water, etc. (Note! see also Ref.). - Sandboxes for fire extinguishing near boilers, etc. - Axes, crowbars, buckets, portable drills, portable cutting equipment, safety lamps, etc. - Helmets, flame-proof suits (asbestos-suits, etc.), gas masks, smoke diving equipment, including separate high pressure compressor with drive unit, fire-proof rope, etc. - Special equipment in fire station (which cannot logically be charged other subgroups). - Boxes (cases), etc. for above mentioned equipment. - Gas protection equipment, gas detectors/indicators, explosimeters and oxygen meters.
references: 381 Sounding, Surveillance and Operating Equipment for Cargo Systems
813 Fire/Wash Down System, Emergency Fire Pumps, Sprinkler System
81 FIRE AND LIFEBOAT ALARM, FIRE FIGHTING AND WASH DOWN SYSTEMS

@value.label: Abc protection equipment
@value.definition: Equipment for detection, removal and destruction of, and protection against radioactive, biological and chemical con- tamination, such as: - Measuring equipment, alarm systems, hosing down, collection and filtration systems. - Protection suits with masks, air supply, etc.
references: 505 Loose Firefighting Apparatuses and Equipment, Firemen's Outfit

@value.label: Security systems
@value.definition: Security equipment such as: - CCTV system, ship access control system, security alert systems, long range acoustic devices.

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@id: 51 INSULATION, PANELS, BULKHEADS, DOORS, SIDE SCUTTLES, SKYLIGHTS

@value.label: Insulation, panels, bulkheads, doors, side scuttles, skylights
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment (Note! special rules for subgroup 512). - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). Also included in the subgroups are: - Instruments, regulating and control (operating) equipment. - Protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds). - Spare parts.
references: 446 Outfitting in Store Rooms and Workshops
448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables
316 Protection Plates, Covers, Hatch Tents and Tarpaulins

@value.label: Partition bulkheads, paneling
@value.definition: Insulation against fire, noise and heat, of ship side, bulkheads, casing, decks, as well as under staircases in accommodation and around engine rooms (in all rooms except freezing/cooling rooms), with such as:

@value.label: Doors with coamings in accommodation
@value.definition: Doors (Note! only purchase/production of) in partition bulkheads/partitions (as defined in subgroup 511), as well as doors of same type, internal, such as: - Cabin/mess room doors. - Corridor/staircase doors. - Sliding doors, folding doors and similar. Included are complete doors with coamings, fittings and equipment, such as: - Hinges and handles. - Locks and closing/locking mechanisms. - Storm hooks and door stoppers. - Footplates, sill plates and crash panels. - Glass and glass framings. - Ventilation throttles. - Sliding door fittings and rails.

@value.label: Other internal doors with coamings
@value.definition: Internal doors (purchase/production and installation) of other types than those included in subgroup 512, such as: - Water-tight doors. - Spray-tight doors. - Gas-tight doors. - Insulated doors (see also Ref.). - Emergency doors. - Store doors (Note! see also Ref.). Included are complete doors with coamings, fittings and equipment, such as: - Hinges and handles. - Locks and locking/closing mechanisms. - Storm hooks and door stoppers. - Foot plates and sill plates. - Covers. - Gaskets. - Ventilation throttles. - Local release mechanisms for water-tight doors (i.e. on board passenger ships) with arrangements for remote control (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 446 Outfitting in Store Rooms and Workshops
811 Fire Detection, Fire and Lifeboat Alarm Systems
448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables
555 Insulation, Lining and Battening in Provision Rooms, Doors and Ports

@value.label: External doors with coamings
@value.definition: Doors (purchase/production and installation) facing open decks, such as: - External doors without special demands to weather/gas tightness. - Weather-/gas-tight doors.

@id: 515 Side Scuttles and Windows with Equipment

@value.label: Side scuttles and windows with equipment
@value.definition: All side scuttles, windows and clear-view screens with fittings and equipment, such as: - Mosquito frames/netting. - Eye brows over windows/side scuttles, drip trays. - Window wiper plant.rotation mechanisms for clear-view screens. - Included are also cutting of holes onboard for side scuttles and windows.
references: 304 Smaller Hatches, Grain Hatches, Manhole Covers

@value.label: Skylights with equipment
@value.definition: All skylights on board, such as: - Engine room skylights. - Pump room skylights. - Galley skylights. - Smaller skylights. Complete skylights with or without glass and frames, including coamings, fittings, hinges, etc. and lifting adjusting and clos- ing arrangements (including possible separate drive units) etc.
references: 304 Smaller Hatches, Grain Hatches, Manhole Covers
515 Side Scuttles and Windows with Equipment
252 Mast, Pump, Fan and Winch Houses, Companion Ways

@value.label: Insulation
@value.definition: Insulation that is not part of walls, ceiling/deck.

@value.label: Ceiling
@value.definition: Interior ceilings that is not part of the group 517.

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@id: 52 INTERNAL DECK COVERING, LADDERS, STEPS, RAILING

@value.label: Internal deck covering, ladders, steps, railing
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transportation costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). Also included in the subgroups are: - Spare parts
references: 522 Internal Deck Top Covering (Linoleum, Tiles, Parquet, etc.)

@value.label: Internal deck base covering
@value.definition: Base covering on internal decks (not in cargo holds and refrigerated rooms), including preparation work (Note! see also Ref.). If only one type of deck covering is laid, which also serves as top covering this is included in subgroup 522.
references: 537 Deck Tables and Chairs, Swimming Pools
522 Internal Deck Top Covering (Linoleum, Tiles, Parquet, etc.)
361 Insulation and Sheathing of Cargo Holds/Tanks

@id: 522 Internal Deck Top Covering (Linoleum, Tiles, Parquet, etc.)

@value.label: Internal deck top covering (linoleum, tiles, parquet, etc.)
@value.definition: Top covering on internal decks (not in cargo holds and refrigerated rooms), with preparation work as e.g. cleaning, grinding and lacquering (Note! See also Ref.), including such as: - Tiles. - Rubber. - Linoleum. - Steel-finished cement. - Parquet. - Plastic. - Wall-to-wall carpeting/carpet-tiles which replace ordinary top covering (Note! see also Ref.). If only one type of deck covering is laid, which also serves as top covering it comes under this subgroup. Included also are boundary bars or similar for the attachment and securing of deck covering, together with interior friction strips (anti-slip-strips) etc. to prevent people slipping on decks and steps.

@value.label: Internal grating and wood decks
@value.definition: Internal gratings (also under forecastle) and wood decks, together with grids, internal and external, in front of doors (not in cargo holds or refrigerated rooms). (Note! see also Ref.). Included here are also preparation work, grinding, etc. and oiling/lacquering of the foregoing, as well as boundary bars, fit- tings and fastening arrangements.
references: 524 Loose Floor Plates, Platforms, Steps and Ladders in Accommodation
556 Walls, Bins, Shelves, Racks, Grating and Invent. in Provision Rooms
522 Internal Deck Top Covering (Linoleum, Tiles, Parquet, etc.)
31 EQUIPMENT FOR CARGO IN HOLDS ON DECK
534 External Platforms, Steps, Ladders and Grating with Equipment

@id: 524 Loose Floor Plates, Platforms, Steps and Ladders in Accommodation

@value.label: Loose floor plates, platforms, steps and ladders in accommodation
@value.definition: Outfitting in accommodation, such as: - Loose floor plates with attachment. - Steps/stairs, ladders and platforms with railings, posts (stanchions), steps, grids (grating), fastening arrangements, etc. - Detached railings and handrails with attachment, etc.
references: 528 Platforms, Ladders and Railing in Cargo Holds
311 Loose Decks and Platforms for Cargo, Ramps
524 Loose Floor Plates, Platforms, Steps and Ladders in Accommodation
526 Ladders, Platforms and Railing in Ballast and Fuel Tanks
527 Platforms, Ladders and Railing in Cargo Tanks
525 Loose Floor Plates, Platforms and Ladders in Engine and Pump Rooms
522 Internal Deck Top Covering (Linoleum, Tiles, Parquet, etc.)
534 External Platforms, Steps, Ladders and Grating with Equipment

@id: 525 Loose Floor Plates, Platforms and Ladders in Engine and Pump Rooms

@value.label: Loose floor plates, platforms and ladders in engine and pump rooms
@value.definition: Similar outfitting as mentioned in subgroup 524, in engine- and pump rooms, casing, funnel, cofferdam, peaks, under fore- castle and similar, as well as other rooms for machinery (boiler rooms, generator rooms, steering gear compartment, etc.).
references: 226 Decks, Platforms, Bulkheads, and Hull Tanks Below First Deck

@id: 526 Ladders, Platforms and Railing in Ballast and Fuel Tanks

@value.label: Ladders, platforms and railing in ballast and fuel tanks
@value.definition: Similar outfitting as mentioned in subgroup 524, in ballast tanks, fuel tanks, freshwater tanks and similar.
references: 527 Platforms, Ladders and Railing in Cargo Tanks
304 Smaller Hatches, Grain Hatches, Manhole Covers

@id: 527 Platforms, Ladders and Railing in Cargo Tanks

@value.label: Platforms, ladders and railing in cargo tanks
@value.definition: Similar outfitting as mentioned in subgroup 524, in tanks for cargo (also in loose gas tanks).
references: 528 Platforms, Ladders and Railing in Cargo Holds

@id: 528 Platforms, Ladders and Railing in Cargo Holds

@value.label: Platforms, ladders and railing in cargo holds
@value.definition: Similar outfitting as mentioned in subgroup 524, in cargo holds, combined cargo holds/tanks (e.g. for ore and oil) and rooms around loose tanks for cargo (e.g. gas tanks).
references: 527 Platforms, Ladders and Railing in Cargo Tanks

@value.label: Emergency exits
@value.definition: All emergency exits with doors, hatches, manholes & ladders.

@id: 53 EXT. DECK COVERING, LADDERS, STEPS, FORE AND AFT GANGWAY

@value.label: Ext. deck covering, ladders, steps, fore and aft gangway
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated:

@value.label: External deck covering
@value.definition: Deck covering on external decks and external platforms including preparation work (see also Ref.). Included also are boundary steel bars and similar for fixing and securing of external deck covering, together with external friction strips (anti-slip strips), etc. to prevent people slipping on decks and stairs.
references: 535 Fore and Aft Gangways with Equipment
387 Special Structures for Loading/Discharging Over Stern/Stem
537 Deck Tables and Chairs, Swimming Pools
52 INTERNAL DECK COVERING, LADDERS, STEPS, RAILING

@value.label: External wood decks
@value.definition: All external wood decks with preparation work, sanding and similar, and oiling/lacquering, together with boundary bars and fixing arrangements.
references: 535 Fore and Aft Gangways with Equipment
387 Special Structures for Loading/Discharging Over Stern/Stem

@value.label: Handrails, railing, rail gates
@value.definition: All external handrails on bulkheads (of steel, wood, plastic or similar) with fittings, etc. Top rails (e.g. wooden rails) on bulwarks. Railings on external decks, platforms and steps, including stanchions, rails, fittings, hinges, etc. Rail ports (gates) with fittings and hinges, etc. (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 535 Fore and Aft Gangways with Equipment
387 Special Structures for Loading/Discharging Over Stern/Stem
564 Shore Gangways with Davits, Landing Booms
267 Gutter Bars, Bulwark, Breakwaters, Gas Barriers
52 INTERNAL DECK COVERING, LADDERS, STEPS, RAILING

@id: 534 External Platforms, Steps, Ladders and Grating with Equipment

@value.label: External platforms, steps, ladders and grating with equipment
@value.definition: Ladders, steps/stairs, platforms, gratings/grids on external decks and on external superstructure/deck house with fittings, etc. (see also Ref.).

@id: 535 Fore and Aft Gangways with Equipment

@value.label: Fore and aft gangways with equipment
@value.definition: Fore-and-aft gangways (catwalk, storm bridge) with: - Brackets for pipe and cable ways where these are part of the construction. - Ladders, steps and platforms to gangway. - Railings on the gangway and associated ladders/steps. - Gratings, deck planking or covering on gangway. If the ship has railings on deck or over hatch covers, instead of a fore and-aft gangway (ships with high free board), this equipment comes under this subgroup.
references: 387 Special Structures for Loading/Discharging Over Stern/Stem
564 Shore Gangways with Davits, Landing Booms
534 External Platforms, Steps, Ladders and Grating with Equipment

@value.label: Awnings with equipment
@value.definition: Awnings (permanent and/or loose), complete with supports, beams, ridge poles and stretchers, sail maker's articles or sim- ilar, deck fittings, etc.
references: 374 Vent./Gas Freeing Systems for Tanks, Wind Sails with Equipment
316 Protection Plates, Covers, Hatch Tents and Tarpaulins
534 External Platforms, Steps, Ladders and Grating with Equipment

@id: 537 Deck Tables and Chairs, Swimming Pools

@value.label: Deck tables and chairs, swimming pools
@value.definition: The following equipment for passengers and crew, on external decks: - Deck tables and deck chairs. - Parasols. - Swimming pools which can be rigged up or which are welded on the weather deck, complete with equipment for rig- ging up, ladders, railings, tiles, etc. Also included is equipment for swimming pools which are integrated in the hull, e.g. tiles, ladders, railings, etc.

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Furniture, inventory, entertainment equipment
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). Also included in the subgroup are: - Mountings. - Spare parts.
references: 537 Deck Tables and Chairs, Swimming Pools

@value.label: Furniture for crew standard type
@value.definition: Furniture for crew (officers and men), in such as: - Cabins (including pilot and owner's cabins and hospital). - Day rooms and saloons. - Messes and cafeteria. - Dressing rooms, baggage rooms, cleaning lockers and other special rooms for the crew. - Working rooms (Note! Only standard furniture). Included here are such as: - Buffets, chests of drawers. - Tables and chairs. - Writing desks in cabins. - Bunks, sofas and bedside tables. - Loose wardrobes (see also Ref.). - Toilet shelves and wardrobe shelves. - Book shelves and wardrobe shelves. - Refrigerators in cabins. - Special furniture for the crew such as bar counter, bar locker, bar stools, etc. The subgroup also includes stuffing and covering, together with possible over covers for the above furniture.
references: 446 Outfitting in Store Rooms and Workshops
537 Deck Tables and Chairs, Swimming Pools
448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables
315 Deck/Hold Cargo Pillars, Bins, Shelves, Cases

@value.label: Office equipment and special furniture
@value.definition: Office equipment, located in offices and other rooms, including such as: - Typewriters, calculating machines, cash registers. - Safes, filing cabinets, key lockers, paper holders, etc. - Desks (counters), office shelves, engine room desk. Special furniture in the ship's working rooms, i.e.: - Offices, conference/teaching rooms. - Wheelhouse, chartroom, radio room. - Gyro room, control room. - Shop, slop chest, strong room and luggage room. Included here are such as: - Special chairs (pilot's chair), tables, lockers, shelves, racks, etc. - Chart table and racks, binocular box. - Lockers for flag equipment, signal lamps, etc. - Key locker. - Equipment for conference-/education room such as blackboard, white board, screen, slide picture projector, overhead projector, etc.
references: 427 Light and Signal Equipment, Lanterns, Typhoons
417 Nautical Utility Equipment, Clockworks, Weather Facsimile
504 Medical, First Aid and Dental Equipment, Medicines

@value.label: Bedcloth, mattresses
@value.definition: Equipment for all bunks on board, including such as: - Mattresses. - Eiderdowns, pillows, blankets, quilts and bedspreads. - Sheets, covers, pillow cases, etc.

@value.label: Curtains, carpets
@value.definition: All equipment (furnishings) of the following categories: - Curtains, porters, shower and bed curtains with curtain rails and opening arrangements. - Floor runners, mats and bedside carpets with possible securing. - Rugs and carpets (not wall-to-wall) with possible securing. - Wall-to-wall carpets/carpet-tiles, which are laid on top of normal deck covering, e.g. on linoleum (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 522 Internal Deck Top Covering (Linoleum, Tiles, Parquet, etc.)

@value.label: Decorations, figureheads
@value.definition: Embellishments and decorations with mountings, such as: - Flower arrangements. - Paintings, reproductions and photographs with frames. - Knick-knacks and figure/sculptures.

@value.label: Hobby, sports and entertainment equipment
@value.definition: Equipment for entertainment and leisure time activities for crew and passengers, including such as: - Gymnastic equipment and equipment in Finnish bath (or similar). - Sport fishing equipment. - Darkroom equipment. - Library equipment and books (not furniture). - Film projection equipment. - Television sets, radios, gramophones (record players) and tape recorders, cassette players, video plants etc. - Music plant with loud speakers, signal transmitting cables, etc. (see also Ref.). - Games and gaming machines. - Common aerial system for radio and TV in cabins, etc., complete with aerials, signal transmitting cables, etc.
references: 537 Deck Tables and Chairs, Swimming Pools
882 Cable Trays with Installation in Accommodation

@value.label: Inventory, smaller items
@value.definition: All small inventory with mountings, such as: - Hooks. - Soap dishes, toilet paper holders, splash plates for washbasins, etc. - Hand grips. - Ashtrays, wastepaper baskets. - Towel holders.

@value.label: Furniture for passengers
@value.definition: Furniture (special and standard furniture) in passenger cabins and special rooms for passengers, equivalent to the furniture stated under subgroup 541/542. Vehicle drivers in car carriers are considered to be passengers in this connection.

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@id: 55 GALLEY/PANTRY EQUIPMENT, PROVISION PLANTS, LAUNDRY/IRONING EQUIPMENT

@value.label: Galley/pantry equipment, provision plants, laundry/ironing equipment
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Mounting and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). Also included in the subgroups are: - Instruments, regulating and control (operating) equipment. - Protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds). - Fitted flanges for connection to systems. - Spare parts. All auxiliary systems (connected systems) end at the intake flange on the equipment which is described inn the subgroup.

@value.label: Galley food cooking equipment
@value.definition: All galley machinery used for cooking purposes, complete with fastening, (usually) placed in galley or a pantry such as: - Ovens, all types (Combi, bakery, microwave, pastry, pizza, etc) - Griddle plates, (Smoothed, grooved, etc) - Ranges - Deep fat fryers - Cookers, (Rice, pasta, etc) - Salamanders - Soup Warmers

@value.label: Galley food preparation and serving
@value.definition: All galley machinery used for food preparation and serving purposes, complete with fastening, (usually) placed in galley and pantry such as: - Hot counters and displays, all types - Slicers, all types - Peelers, all types - Mixers, all types - Dispensers, all types - Dishwashing equipment Additionally all types of loose galley equipment, such as: - Knives, scissors, spades, ladles. - Saucepans, frying pans, pots. - Galley textiles, brushes, buckets, etc.

@value.label: Galley/pantry refrigeration
@value.definition: All galley & pantry refrigeration equipment such as: - Refrigerators, (Reach-in, roll in etc) - Chillers - Ice Machines - Water Coolers

@id: 553006 Frost Tops with Refrigerated Under Counters

@value.label: Frost tops with refrigerated under counters
Freezing/refrigerating systems for provisions
@value.definition: Freezing/refrigerating system for provisions (supplies) and other goods, (excluding ice cube machines) for crew and pas- sengers, including such as: - Piping for brine/Freon, etc. with valves, penetration pieces, insulation etc. - Separate cooling water system with separate pumps, pipes, etc. (not connected to the ship's central cooling water sys- tem), for the freezing/refrigerating system for provisions. - Compressors and pumps, including drive unit, as well as fans with drive unit for air circulation through cooling bat- teries, including regulation and control equipment. - Condensers, evaporators, cooling batteries, drip trays, separate drain pipes as well as defrosting plant. - Plant for remote measuring of temperature, humidity/moisture. - Possible poison concentration, etc. in the provision rooms and in connection with the machinery/systems for provisions.
references: 572 Ventilation/Air Conditioning Systems for Provision Rooms
36 FREEZING, REFRIGERATING AND HEATING SYSTEMS FOR CARGO

@id: 555 Insulation, Lining and Battening in Provision Rooms, Doors and Ports

@value.label: Insulation, lining and battening in provision rooms, doors and ports
@value.definition: Insulating and lining/sheathing in the provision rooms (also dry-provision rooms), including such as: - Pegwood with lugs, etc. - Insulation of tank-top, bulkheads, hull underside of decks (also of possible hatchway coamings) and of manhole covers. - Lining/sheathing and moisture barriers for protection of insulation. - Deck coating for protection of insulation. - Flat bars for limitation of strip insulation, etc. - Battens on the lining/sheathing. Insulated doors and/or ports to refrigerated rooms for provisions, complete with such as: - Coaming and door/port. - Insulation, lining and gaskets. - Hinges, fittings and closing mechanism. Containers with associated equipment, for storage of provisions are also included here.
references: 304 Smaller Hatches, Grain Hatches, Manhole Covers
556 Walls, Bins, Shelves, Racks, Grating and Invent. in Provision Rooms
52 INTERNAL DECK COVERING, LADDERS, STEPS, RAILING
361 Insulation and Sheathing of Cargo Holds/Tanks

@id: 556 Walls, Bins, Shelves, Racks, Grating and Invent. in Provision Rooms

@value.label: Walls, bins, shelves, racks, grating and invent. in provision rooms
@value.definition: Outfitting and inventory in the provision rooms (refrigerated and dry-provision rooms), including such as: - Partition bulkheads (partitions). - Bins, trays, ribs, shelves, racks and brackets with fittings, meat chopping blocks, workbenches, meat axes, saws, etc., as well as gratings.
references: 572 Ventilation/Air Conditioning Systems for Provision Rooms
31 EQUIPMENT FOR CARGO IN HOLDS ON DECK
555 Insulation, Lining and Battening in Provision Rooms, Doors and Ports

@id: 557 Insulation Drying Systems for Provision Rooms

@value.label: Insulation drying systems for provision rooms
@value.definition: Insulation drying system for provision rooms, e.g. by means of dry air, including such as: - Ducts and pipes with valves, etc. - Fans with drive unit. - Dehydrator, etc.
references: 385 Insulation Drying System for Cargo Holds/Tanks
572 Ventilation/Air Conditioning Systems for Provision Rooms

@value.label: Laundry, ironing and drying equipment
@value.definition: All equipment and machinery with mountings, in laundry/drying room (also in laundry for the crew), such as: - Workbenches, disbursing benches, washing and soaking basins. - Washing machines. - Spin dryers, presses, drying aggregates and drying lockers (for clothing etc.). - Mangles, ironing table, ironing machines and irons. - Sewing table and sewing machines. - Shelves, racks and lockers for clothes.

@value.label: Bar serving equipment
@value.definition: This group is applicable to passenger vessels having excessive amount of bar serving equipment such as: - Mixers, blenders and various types of dispensers. - Cafeteria counters with heating and refrigeration equipment, etc.

@id: 56 TRANSPORT EQUIPMENT FOR CREW, PASSENGERS AND PROVISIONS

@value.label: Transport equipment for crew, passengers and provisions
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). Also included in the subgroups are: - Instruments, regulating and control (operating) equipment. - Protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds). - Spare parts.
references: 45 LIFTING AND TRANSPORT EQUIPMENT FOR MACHINERY COMPONENTS
34 MASTS, DERRICK POSTS, RIGGING AND WINCHES FOR CARGO

@value.label: Personnel lifts, escalators
@value.definition: Lifts (elevators) with doors and cars (gondolas) and/or escalators for crew and passengers, complete with machinery.
references: 564 Shore Gangways with Davits, Landing Booms

@value.label: Food and linen lifts
@value.definition: Food lift (galley lift) and/or linen lift, complete with machinery and possibly separate lift shaft.

@value.label: Provision cranes and derricks
@value.definition: Lifting and transport equipment (excluding equipment in subgroups 561 and 562) for provisions, luggage and similar (Note! see Ref.), including such as: - Provision cranes and derricks, with lifting machinery, separate drive units, fittings, rigging, etc. - Travelling hoist in provision room with tracks, lifting machinery, etc. - Conveyor belts, trolleys and similar, for provisions and luggage. If the provision derricks/cranes are also used for handling other goods, i.e. dry cargo, machinery components, cargo hoses, etc., their main function i.e. the function that determines their lifting capacity, decides the subgroup they come under (see also Ref.).
references: 45 LIFTING AND TRANSPORT EQUIPMENT FOR MACHINERY COMPONENTS
34 MASTS, DERRICK POSTS, RIGGING AND WINCHES FOR CARGO

@id: 564 Shore Gangways with Davits, Landing Booms

@value.label: Shore gangways with davits, landing booms
@value.definition: Shore gangway and landing equipment, including such as: - Shore/accommodation ladder davits with rigging and separate winches with drive units. - Railing/bulwark steps (ladders), pilot ladder/hoist. - Landing booms (booms for setting people ashore in the St. Lawrence Seaway or similar) with rigging, derrick posts and possible separate lifting machinery, etc.
references: 534 External Platforms, Steps, Ladders and Grating with Equipment
267 Gutter Bars, Bulwark, Breakwaters, Gas Barriers

@value.label: Misc. conveyance equipment
@value.definition: Miscellaneous aids for conveyance on board, including such as: - Rafts for use in tanks. - Scooters. - Trolleys and rails etc. in pipe ways (or in similar duct/tunnel in the double bottom).
references: 452 Travelling Cranes and Lifting Gear in Engine Room

@value.label: Helicopter platforms with equipment
@value.definition: Landing area for helicopter, including such as: - Separate platform construction with supports/pillars, low rails, etc. - Fuel ducts (gutters) with possible separate pipes, tank and pump with drive unit, etc. - Ladders/stairs, railings and safety net. - Special deck covering and impregnation. - Anchoring points and lashing wire.
references: 427 Light and Signal Equipment, Lanterns, Typhoons
883 Cable Trays and Installation on Deck and in Cargo Holds
505 Loose Firefighting Apparatuses and Equipment, Firemen's Outfit
417 Nautical Utility Equipment, Clockworks, Weather Facsimile
504 Medical, First Aid and Dental Equipment, Medicines
81 FIRE AND LIFEBOAT ALARM, FIRE FIGHTING AND WASH DOWN SYSTEMS

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@id: 57 VENTILATION, AIR CONDITIONING AND HEATING SYSTEMS

@value.label: Ventilation, air conditioning and heating systems
@value.definition: The subgroups include unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). The systems in the subgroups also include all associated system components, such as: - Pipes and ducts with bends, T-pieces, brackets, expansion arrangements, penetration pieces, valves, spindle extensions, flaps, jealousies, filters, diffusers, insulation with covering. - Fans with drive units, heating and cooling batteries with associated separate machinery. - Instruments, regulating and control (operating) equipment. - Protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds). - Fitted flanges for connection to systems and associated components. - Spare parts. All auxiliary (connected) systems end at the intake flange on the system described in the subgroup.
references: 51 INSULATION, PANELS, BULKHEADS, DOORS, SIDE SCUTTLES, SKYLIGHTS

@value.label: Ventilation/air conditioning systems for accommodation
@value.definition: Natural or mechanical ventilation systems or air conditioning systems for accommodation (also for wheelhouse, radio room and similar, together with other spaces/rooms served by the accommodation ventilation system), including such as: - Air Handling Units (AHU), normally referring to the main air conditioning unit on the ventilation side. - Fan Coil Unit (FCU), normally installed in guest and crew cabins. - Fan Room Fan Coil Units (FFCU), installed in fan rooms and they are part of the main air conditioning for public areas. - Area Fan Coil Units (AFCU), normally installed in the areas and they are part of the main air conditioning system for public areas. - Air fans with drive units. - Air pipes for natural ventilation. - Air ducts/pipes to and from the rooms with fitted filters, valves, flaps, ventilation cabinets, heating/cooling batteries, equipment for steam injection (for humidity regulation), etc. - Possible separate hot water pipes from the central water heating boiler to heating batteries/ventilation cabinets. - Ventilation centrals in air-conditioning system with fans, filters, valves, heating and cooling batteries, plant for reg- ulating air humidity (be means of cooling, absorption or similar), etc.

@id: 571004 Fan Room Coil Units, (FRCU) for Public Areas

@value.label: Fan room coil units, (frcu) for public areas

@id: 571005 Area Fan Coil Units, (AFCU) for Public Areas

@value.label: Area fan coil units, (afcu) for public areas

@id: 572 Ventilation/Air Conditioning Systems for Provision Rooms

@value.label: Ventilation/air conditioning systems for provision rooms
@value.definition: Separate ventilation/air-conditioning systems for provision rooms (refrigerated and dry-provision rooms) and/or galley with similar arrangement and equipment as stated under subgroup 571. Ozone plant and humidity regulating plant for air- conditioning of the above rooms, wind catches/deflectors for side scuttles and fans, etc.
references: 557 Insulation Drying Systems for Provision Rooms

@id: 573 Ventilation/Air Conditioning Systems for Control Rooms

@value.label: Ventilation/air conditioning systems for control rooms
@value.definition: Separate ventilation/air-conditioning systems for control room, workshops in engine room and EDP room, with similar arrangement and equipment as stated in subgroup 571.
references: 576 Ventilation/Air Cond. Systems for Steering Gear Compartments
574 Ventilation/Air Conditioning Systems for Boiler/Engine Rooms

@id: 574 Ventilation/Air Conditioning Systems for Boiler/Engine Rooms

@value.label: Ventilation/air conditioning systems for boiler/engine rooms
@value.definition: Separate ventilation/air-conditioning systems for boiler/engine rooms and adjoining rooms for machinery, such as: - Gear room. - Generator room. - Separator room. - Stabilizer room. The subgroup includes similar arrangements and equipment as stated under subgroup 571.
references: 576 Ventilation/Air Cond. Systems for Steering Gear Compartments
575 Ventilation/Air Conditioning Systems for Pump Rooms
637 Main Reduction Gears with Thrust Bearings and Couplings

@id: 575 Ventilation/Air Conditioning Systems for Pump Rooms

@value.label: Ventilation/air conditioning systems for pump rooms
@value.definition: Separate ventilation/air-conditioning systems for spaces (not cargo holds) where danger of gas, explosion, poisoning and similar exists, e.g.: - Pump rooms. - Cofferdams, pipe ducts (tunnel) in double bottom. - Gas compressor room and gas locks. - Rooms for cargo hoses. The subgroup includes similar arrangement and equipment as stated under subgroup 571.
references: 574 Ventilation/Air Conditioning Systems for Boiler/Engine Rooms
373 Open Ventilation Systems for Cargo Holds

@id: 576 Ventilation/Air Cond. Systems for Steering Gear Compartments

@value.label: Ventilation/air cond. systems for steering gear compartments
@value.definition: Separate ventilation/air-conditioning systems for rooms such as: - Steering gear compartment. - Emergency generator room, accumulator room. - Side thruster compartments. - Electric motor room, rooms for deck machinery, refrigerating machinery, etc. - CO2 room. - Store rooms (not for provisions). - Workshops situated outside engine room. - Spaces in the forecastle, for and after peak. - Factory spaces in fishing vessels, etc. The subgroup includes similar arrangement and equipment as stated under subgroup 571.

@value.label: Central heating systems with radiators
@value.definition: Central heating system with radiators or similar, for all rooms on board, except cargo holds, including such as: - Radiators, heating pipes or similar heating units (not electrical). - Expansion tanks. - Separate pipes with valves, fittings, etc. between radiators, separate supply lines with possible circulation pump for main water heating boiler (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 84 CENTRAL HEAT TRANSFER SYSTEMS WITH CHEMICAL FLUIDS/OIL
648 Central Heating and Thermal Oil Boilers
75 STEAM, CONDENSATE AND FEED WATER SYSTEMS
365 Indirect Cooling/Heating Systems, Cargo Oil Heating

@value.label: Ventilation duct cleaning
@value.definition: Special steam washing system for ventilation duct, including piping.

@value.label: Fire damper system
@value.definition: Including all types of fire dampers, such as manual, electrical and pneumatic activated. Additionally the smoke and hood extraction systems.

@value.label: Sanitary and waste systems
@value.definition: The subgroups include unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). The systems in the subgroups include all associated system components such as: - Pipes with bends, T-pieces, brackets, penetrating pieces, valves, spindle extensions, filters, sieves, taps, fittings, insu- lation with covering, etc. - Pumps with drive units, loose tanks, water heaters, etc.

@value.label: Sanitary supply systems
@value.definition: Sanitary fresh and salt water systems for supply of hot and cold water, including such as: - Hoses with connections and piping for filling of the sanitary fresh water tanks. - Sanitary pump with suction pipes, including gland flanges, from sanitary fresh water tanks and/or from the sea. - Pressure pipes from the sanitary pressure tank to all taps on board and to water heaters (including these). - Pressure pipes from water heaters to all taps on board and return pipes with possible circulation pump to water heat- ers. - Possible branch lines to such as feed water tank, cooling water expansion tank and separator (Note! See also Ref.). - Heating coils in sanitary tanks. In the systems are included taps (faucets), regulating taps, showers, mixing batteries, valves, filters, cleaning equipment, ordinary drinking fountains (without cooling unit), etc.
references: 648 Central Heating and Thermal Oil Boilers
75 STEAM, CONDENSATE AND FEED WATER SYSTEMS
583 Bathtubs, Bidets, Shower Cabinets, WC, Washbasins

@value.label: Sanitary discharge and drainage systems
@value.definition: Sanitary discharge systems with air pipes and drainage systems for the accommodation, from such as: - Toilets, urinal, bidets, etc. - Bathtubs, swimming pools, fountains. - Washstands, basins for dishwashing, soaking, etc. The systems include such as: - Pipes with valves, water traps, drains, etc. - Discharge pipes from bathtubs, washbasins, etc., to drains. - Scuppers in the accommodation. - Separate sewage tank, sewage pump with drive unit, overboard discharge, storm valves, and drainage ejector from sewage tank, etc. Alternatively, vacuum plant for discharge from toilets, urinals, possibly from the galley, etc., is included, comprising: - Vacuum tank and possible collection tank. - Vacuum pump and possible discharge pump with drive unit, etc. - Pipes for air and sewage with fittings, valves, etc. - Automatic control of pumps, tanks, valves, etc. Here is also included plants/equipment for cleaning and treatment including such as, decomposition, disinfection, filtering, separation, absorption, drying/evaporation, etc., of sewage water from WC's, bathtubs, washstands, laundry, galley (includ- ing possible connection to garbage grinder in galley), etc., including such as: - Buffer tank, recirculation tanks, storage tanks and other loose tanks. - Reaction tank and dosing apparatus (including chemicals). - Discharge pumps with drive unit, etc., (recirculation pumps) with possible compressor. - Pipes and automation equipment in connection with the above, with fittings, valves, etc., with possible air pipe and air cleaner. - Equipment for collection of remains or possible transporter or similar connection with the garbage incinerator (Note! See also Ref.).
references: 537 Deck Tables and Chairs, Swimming Pools
583 Bathtubs, Bidets, Shower Cabinets, WC, Washbasins

@id: 583 Bathtubs, Bidets, Shower Cabinets, WC, Washbasins

@value.label: Bathtubs, bidets, shower cabinets, wc, washbasins
@value.definition: Large sanitary components such as: - Bathtubs. - Bidets. - Shower cabinets, complete, prefabricated floor modules for bathroom/WC's (toilet cabin). - WC's with seats and foundation plates. - Washbasins (stands) and foot basins. - Urinals, etc.
references: 537 Deck Tables and Chairs, Swimming Pools

@value.label: Incinerator with equipment
@value.definition: Incinerator for garbage, etc. (or other garbage disposal device), for rubbish, kitchen refuse, sanitary system sludge, fuel and lubricating oil sludge, and possible other waste, complete with all fixtures and equipment, and associated systems and equipment such as: - Garbage filling chutes and emergency chute with ducts, etc. and feeding transporters (Note! See also Ref.). - Fuel oil arrangement with storage tanks, pipes, valves and pumps with drive unit, filters, etc. - Fans and other equipment for air supply. - Exhaust system with ducts, insulation, flaps, fans with drive unit, suspensions, penetration pieces, expansion devices, equipment for cleaning and inspection of exhaust, possible heat exchangers, etc. - Ash and slag chute with ducts, etc. and ash transporter and discharge equipment. - Separate cooling/washing system with pipes, pumps with drive units, valves, etc. and other systems/equipment for the destruction unit only.

@value.label: Garbage treatment plants
@value.definition: Including food waste system, shredders, compactors, crushers and the aerosol can disposal system. This group also covers special waste handling materials.

@id: 59 PASSENGER VESSELS CABINS, PUBLIC ROOMS AND POOLS, ETC.

@value.label: Passenger vessels cabins, public rooms and pools, etc.
@value.definition: Group 59 is reserved for passenger ships. The contents and sub-divisions are, as yet, undecided. For cargo ships with accommodation for a limited number of passengers, primary group 5 in this manner is to be used; In such ships, furniture in cabins and special passenger areas come under the respective subgroup n.primary group.5. Special equipment, including swimming pools, whirlpools and the associated equipment such as, filling and discharging, filtration, chlorination and control equipment. Additionally water effect installations such as, waterfalls, etc.

The diesel engines also include: - Turbochargers, auxiliary/emergency blowers, scavenging air coolers, receivers and ducts. - Mounted (integrated) thrust shaft, thrust bearing and turning gear. - Mounted pipes with fittings (also air pipes from spaces for camshaft drive arrangement), high pressure fuel oil pumps and injection valves, distribution arrangement for cylinder lubrication, starting air valves, indicators, etc.

@value.label: Fixed propeller plants including.nozzles
@value.definition: Propeller plants with one or more fixed propellers (not counter-rotating or stern/bottom propeller plants) for propulsion. The plants also include: - Propeller shaft(s) with liners (bushings), wedge, lock nut and cap, etc - Propeller stern tube(s) with inserts, stuffing box, packing equipment, protection plates, etc. (including drilling of stern frame and withdrawal of the stern tube). - Intermediate shafts. - Coupling bolts for shafts. Separate thrust bearing/thrust shaft with thrust shoes, cover, segments, shims (spacers), trestles, etc. (see also Ref.). Bearings for shaft with lubricating apparatus, bolts, shims (spacers), etc. Bulkhead stuffing box, complete, for shaft penetration. Possible propeller nozzles fixed to the hull or to the propeller (Note! Also Ref.). Also included here are spare shafts for the above mentioned plants with possible bolts, wedges and lock nut, as well as foundation/attachment.

@id: 638 Central Gears (Joint Aux. Gear, Not for Propulsion)

@value.label: Central gears (joint aux. gear, not for propulsion)
@value.definition: Central gear (joint auxiliary gear, assembling gear, branching gear) with more power outlets for operation of machinery of different subgroups (excluding propulsion machinery, see Ref.). The gear is for example driven from propulsion motor or main gear, and includes such as: - Flexible coupling between gear and motor. - Possible extension shaft between motor and gear. - Free coupling. - Mounted equipment and piping with fittings, filter, oil cooler and pump, equipment for dry air ventilation etc. - Brackets for flange mounting. Here is also included alternative joint power transmission arrangement for operation of similar (above mentioned) machinery. The transmission can for example be driven from flange at fore end of crank shaft, chain register, separate gear-wheel on crank shaft (main engine) or from power outlets from main gear and includes such as: - Flexible coupling, possible free coupling. - Pulley(s)/chain wheel(s). - Belts/chains. - Transmission shaft with bearings.

@value.label: Boilers, steam and gas generators
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment, including shims (spacers), boiler stays and bolts. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). The main components also include: - Mounted instruments, regulators and control (operation) equipment. - Protection covers. - Masonry, insulation and lining. - Mounted gratings. - Fitted flanges for connection to systems and associated components. - Tools delivered with the vessel. - Spare parts. All auxiliary systems (connected systems) end at the connecting flange on the main components in the subgroups.
references: 754 Primary Drain, Blow-Off, Exhaust Steam and Deaeration System in Engine Room
505 Loose Firefighting Apparatuses and Equipment, Firemen's Outfit
223 Inner Bottom with Stiffening, Engine Foundations

@value.label: Main steam boilers
@value.definition: Boilers for steam production, primarily for propulsion machinery. The plant also includes: - Furnace front, burners with torches (or equivalent) and mounted equipment (Note! see also Ref.). - Super heater, reheater, air preheater and economizers. - Boiler fans with drive unit, ducts, etc. (see also Ref.). - Mounted pipes with fittings, air and water separators, separate drain tank. - Equipment for addition of chemicals, mounted to boilers. - Laboratory equipment for boiler supervision/observation (orsat-apparatuses, salinometer, coolers for boiler water- /exhaust tests, etc.) - Soot blowing plant (Note! see also Ref.).

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Aux. steam boilers
@value.definition: Fired boilers and electro-boilers for steam production, primarily for auxiliary machinery and heating. The plant includes equivalent equipment, as mentioned in subgroup 641, as well as boiler automation equipment for smal- ler auxiliary boilers, e.g. donkey boilers (see also Ref.).
references: 648 Central Heating and Thermal Oil Boilers

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Exhaust gas boilers
@value.definition: Exhaust gas boilers and combined fired boiler/exhaust gas boiler for steam production (or equivalent) primarily for aux- iliary machinery and heating. The plant also includes equivalent equipment, as mentioned in subgroup 641, as well as automation equipment for boilers (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 648 Central Heating and Thermal Oil Boilers

@value.label: Steam converters
@value.definition: Steam converters (separate steam generators) for production of low-pressure steam by means of high-pressure steam, for auxiliary machinery and heating. Here is also included steam generator heated by chemical liquid (e.g. heating oil). The plant also includes equivalent equipment, as mentioned in subgroup 641, as well as automation equipment for the con- verters (Note! see also Ref.).

@id: 648 Central Heating and Thermal Oil Boilers

@value.label: Central heating and thermal oil boilers
@value.definition: Water heaters for central heating plant; for sanitary purposes and for heating e.g. by means of radiators. Here is also included central heating boiler heated by exhaust gas. Low pressure boilers for heating with chemical liquid (not water) as heat transfer mediums (e.g. "thermal oil"). The plants also include equivalent equipment mentioned in subgroup 641 as well as automation equipment for the boilers (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 84 CENTRAL HEAT TRANSFER SYSTEMS WITH CHEMICAL FLUIDS/OIL

@value.label: Gas generators
@value.definition: Isolated (separate) gas generators primarily for propulsion gas turbines, e.g. free piston engines or compressors with steam turbine drive unit which are placed separated from the power turbine. The plant also includes: - Scavenging air receiver and exhaust gas receiver. - Mounted pipes, fittings, high-pressure fuel oil pumps and injection valves, distribution apparatus for cylinder lub- rication, starting air valves, etc.
references: 376 Inert Gas Systems with Conditioning Plant
621 Gas Turbines with Air Preheaters for Propulsion

@id: 65 DIESEL ENGINES FOR MAIN ELECTRIC POWER PRODUCTION

@value.label: Diesel engines for main electric power production
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment, including shims (spacers), stop blocks and blocks. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). The main components also include: - Mounted instruments and regulators/governors. - Local control (operating) equipment. - Protection covers. - Magnetizing dynamo. - Air coolers and generators. - Insulation and lining. - Mounted gratings. - Fitted flanges for connection to systems and associated components. - Tools delivered with the vessel. - Spare parts. All auxiliary systems (connected systems) end at the connecting flange on the main components in the subgroups.
references: 44 REPAIR/MAINT./CLEAN. EQUIPMENT WORKSHOP/STORE OUTFIT, NAME PLATES

@value.label: Aux. diesel generator aggregates
@value.definition: Auxiliary engines with generators (motor generators, diesels generating sets) for main electric power production, also including such as: - Gear, couplings between engine and generator. - Turbo chargers, scavenging air receivers, scavenging air coolers and exhaust gas receivers. - Mounted turning gear. - Mounted pipes with fittings, high-pressure fuel oil pumps and injection valves, distribution apparatus for cylinder lub- rication, starting air valves, lubricating oil cooler and pump, etc.
references: 226 Decks, Platforms, Bulkheads, and Hull Tanks Below First Deck
66 OTHER AGGREGATES FOR ELECTRIC POWER PRODUCTION

@value.label: Other aggregates for electric power production

The main components also include: - Mounted instruments and regulators/governors. - Local control (operating) equipment. - Protection covers. - Insulation and lining. - Magnetizing dynamo. - Air coolers and generators. - Mounted gratings. - Fitted flanges for connection to systems and associated components. - Tools delivered with the vessel. - Spare parts. All auxiliary systems (connected systems) end at the connecting flange on the main components in the subgroups.

@value.label: Steam turbo aggregates
@value.definition: Auxiliary steam turbines with generators (turbo generators) for main electric power production, also including such as: - Gear and couplings between turbine and generator, as well as clutches for possible connection to the main reduction gear. - Mounted pipes with fittings, admission valves, etc.
references: 75 STEAM, CONDENSATE AND FEED WATER SYSTEMS

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@id: 663 Gas Turbo Aggregates for Electric Power Production

@value.label: Gas turbo aggregates for electric power production
@value.definition: Auxiliary gas turbines with generators for main electric power production, acting as for instance stand-by and/or top load aggregate (Note! See also Ref.). The plant also includes: - Gas turbine which drives generator and at the same time delivers gas to the inert gas system. - Reduction gears and couplings between turbine and reduction gear. - Mounted pipes with fittings, air preheaters, fuel oil pumps, injection valves, etc. - The subgroup also covers turbo-container units complete with connected separate equipment (that is not naturally covered by other subgroups).
references: 376 Inert Gas Systems with Conditioning Plant
621 Gas Turbines with Air Preheaters for Propulsion
744 Exhaust Gas Systems for Motor Aggregates
663 Gas Turbo Aggregates for Electric Power Production

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Emergency generator aggregates with equipment
@value.definition: Engine with generator for use in emergency situations (Note! see also Ref.). The plant includes equivalent equipment mentioned in subgroups 651, 661 or 663, as well as appurtenant separate sys- tems/equipment, e.g.: - Exhaust gas system (smoke uptake) with ducts, insulation, expansion equipment, etc. - Fuel oil system with storage tanks, possible heat exchangers, pump with drive unit, pipelines with valves, etc. - Lube oil system, cooling water system and other separate systems for the aggregate with similar system components as mentioned above. - Separate starting battery and charging rectifier.

@value.label: Harbour aux. diesel engine
@value.definition: Engine with generator for use in harbour situations (Note! See also Ref.). The plant includes equivalent equipment mentioned in subgroups 651, 661 or 663, as well as appurtenant separate sys- tems/equipment, e.g.: - Exhaust gas system (smoke uptake) with ducts, insulation, expansion equipment, etc. - Fuel oil system with storage tanks, possible heat exchangers, pump with drive unit, pipelines with valves, etc. - Lube oil system, cooling water system and other separate systems for the aggregate with similar system components as mentioned above. - Separate starting battery and charging rectifier.

@value.label: Shaft generators
@value.definition: Shaft generators driven by the propulsion machinery or the main reduction gear, also including such as: - Couplings and power transmissions from the main engine/main reduction gear, alternatively separate gear between main engine and shaft generator. - Mounted pipes with fittings, etc.
references: 637 Main Reduction Gears with Thrust Bearings and Couplings

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Generators with hydraulic drive
@value.definition: Generators with hydraulic drive for main electric power production. The plant also includes: - Hydraulic motor with separate oil supply plant, including pump (for instance driven from the main engine), pump coup- lings, expansion tank, hydraulic pipes and mounted fittings.

@value.label: Systems for machinery main components
@value.definition: Systems serving main machinery components, for example fuel and lubrication oil systems, starting air system, exhaust systems and automation systems.

@value.label: Fuel systems
@value.definition: The group includes the ship's main fuel systems, i.e. systems for distribution, treatment and supply of liquid fuel, gas fuel or solid fuel to machinery main components (machinery in primary group 6) and possibly to miscellaneous machinery sup- plied by the same systems (Note! see also Ref.). The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. The systems in the subgroups include all associated system components, such as: - Pumps and compressors with drive units, coolers, preheaters, loose tanks, receivers, containers, e.g. loose day tanks, heating coils in fuel oil tanks, etc. - Pipes/ducts with bends, T-pieces, flanges, suspensions, clamps, expansion arrangements, penetration pieces, dis- tribution boxes (valve boxes), filters, water separators/-extractors, etc. - Valves with spindle extension or separate hydraulic valve control system. - Local instruments (thermometers, manometers, level gauges/glasses, etc.). - Protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds). - Spare parts. All auxiliary systems (connected systems) end at the intake flange on the system described in the subgroup. Preheaters/coolers come under the primary system. Valves, flanges, etc. on hull tanks (tanks where the hull constitutes a part of the tank) come under the subgroup for the sys- tem to which they are connected. Air and sounding pipes (short) for loose tanks, come under the same subgroup as the tanks (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 381 Sounding, Surveillance and Operating Equipment for Cargo Systems
75 STEAM, CONDENSATE AND FEED WATER SYSTEMS
797 Automation Equipment for Other Machinery Components
448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables

@value.label: Fo transfer and drain systems
@value.definition: Transfer and drain systems for the ship's main fuel oil systems (Note! See also Ref.). Drain system for fuel oil (diesel and/or heavy oil), including such as: - Drain pipes with valves, clamps, etc. from drip trays/waste trays, including these, from system components, as well as from bilge water separator and inspection tank (Note! see also Ref.) to fuel oil waste tank. Fuel oil transfer system for tank refilling and removal of oil to different tanks, including such as: - Bunkering hoses with couplings and possible separate bunkering gallows, etc. - Filling pipes with valves, etc. to loose tanks, including these (Note! see also Ref.). - Filling/drain pipes via distribution boxes, including these, to hull tanks with valves, flanges etc. - Suction piping from storage tanks, bottom tanks and possible waste oil tanks to transfer pumps, including these (also fore ship). - Pressure piping from the transfer pumps overboard, to day tanks, to settling tank, to storage tank and to distribution boxes. - Suction piping from waste-oil tank and storage tank to fuel oil separator and pressure piping to the day tanks (Note! see also Ref.), as well as piping from fuel oil separator to gland flange for connection to lubricating oil separator. For ships with combined fuel oil and ballast tanks, where the pipes from the tanks to distribution box can carry both fuel oil and ballast water, these pipes come under this subgroup (Note! see also Ref.).

@value.label: Fo purification plants
@value.definition: Plants for purification and treatment of diesel and/or heavy oil (in the ship's main fuel oil system), including such as: - Fuel oil separators with pumps including drive unit, valves, preheaters mixing units, homogenizers, filters, mounted pipes, loose tanks, etc. and/or plants for filtering, washing and portioning of additives, with associated equipment. - Pipelines between the above mentioned components and possible separate line for from settling tank (Note! see also Ref.). - Pipelines with valves, etc. from fuel oil separators to sludge tank and further, to sludge pump, including this, overboard, to garbage disposal plant and/or to land connection. - Combined fuel oil and lube oil spare separators and common pipeline for fuel oil and lube oil purification plant.

@value.label: Fo supply systems
@value.definition: Systems for supply of fuel oil (diesel and/or heavy oil) from tanks or from branch points in the transfer (main fuel oil) sys- tem to the consumers, such as: - Diesel engines/gas turbines for propulsion. - Diesel engines/gas turbines for generators (Note! see also Ref.). - Boilers, gas generators for gas turbines. - Possible machinery not included in primary group 6 which is supplied by the same system as the above mentioned machinery (Note! see also Ref.). The systems include all system components, such as pipes with bends, etc., valves (also quick closing valves with lockers), filters, water traps, preheaters, auxiliary pumps with drive units, possible loose tanks, etc.

@id: 703002 Heavy Fuel Module for Viscosity Governing, Complete

@value.label: Heavy fuel module for viscosity governing, complete
Heating coils in fo tanks
@value.definition: Heating coils (heating pipes or equivalent) in fuel oil hull tanks and possibly in larger loose tanks, e.g. day tanks (in the main fuel oil system) with connecting pipes. Also included are heating coils in combined fuel oil/ballast tanks (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 84 CENTRAL HEAT TRANSFER SYSTEMS WITH CHEMICAL FLUIDS/OIL
75 STEAM, CONDENSATE AND FEED WATER SYSTEMS
365 Indirect Cooling/Heating Systems, Cargo Oil Heating

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Gas fuel system
@value.definition: System where boil-off gas from the cargo (e.g. methane, LNG) is conditioned and supplied to boilers, motors, gas turbines and similar, or to burn-off plant. The system includes such as: - Bunkering hoses with couplings and possible separate bunkering gallows, etc. - Piping with valves, pressure tank, etc., to dual fuel diesel engines, gas turbines, boilers or to gas burn-off plant. - Compressors with drive units (Note! see also Ref.). - Heat exchangers for conditioning the gas. - Separate ventilation arrangement for pipe/shaft for fuel gas pipes. - Gas burn-off plant. For a combined fuel gas and refrigeration plant, the fuel gas system begins at the pipe connection after the compressor.
references: 355 Loading/Discharging Systems for LPG/LNG in Gaseous Phase
621 Gas Turbines with Air Preheaters for Propulsion
75 STEAM, CONDENSATE AND FEED WATER SYSTEMS
36 FREEZING, REFRIGERATING AND HEATING SYSTEMS FOR CARGO
663 Gas Turbo Aggregates for Electric Power Production

@id: 707040 Intermediate Heat Medium Pumps for ME Gas Injection

@value.label: Intermediate heat medium pumps for me gas injection

@id: 707045 Intermediate Heat Medium Heaters for ME Gas Injection

@value.label: Intermediate heat medium heaters for me gas injection
Solid fuel systems, e.g., coal
@value.definition: Systems for supply, treatment and distribution of solid fuel as for example coal to machinery main components as e.g. main- and auxiliary boilers.

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Lo systems
@value.definition: The group includes the ship's main lube oil systems, i.e. systems for distribution, treatment and supply of lube oil to machinery main components (machinery in primary group 6) and to miscellaneous machinery supplied by the same sys- tems (Note! see also Ref.). The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). The systems in the subgroups include all associated system components, such as: - Pumps, including drive unit, coolers and preheaters, loose tanks, cooling/heating coils in lube oil tanks, etc. - Pipes with bends, T-pieces, flanges, suspensions, clamps, expansion arrangements, penetration pieces, filters, etc. - Valves with spindle extension or separate hydraulic valve control system. - Local instruments (thermometers, manometers, etc.). - Protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds/tanks). - Spare parts. All auxiliary systems (connected systems) end at the intake flange on the system described in the subgroup. Preheaters/coolers come under the primary system (e.g. lube oil coolers, refer to the lube oil system). Valves, flanges, etc., on the hull tanks (tanks where the hull constitutes a part of the tank), come under the subgroup for the system to which they are connected. Air and sounding pipes (short) for loose tanks, come under the same subgroup as the tanks (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 75 STEAM, CONDENSATE AND FEED WATER SYSTEMS
797 Automation Equipment for Other Machinery Components
448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables

@value.label: Lo transfer and drain systems
@value.definition: Transfer and drain systems for the ship's main lubricating oil systems (Note! see also Ref.). Lube oil drain system, including such as: - Drain pipes with valves, clamps, etc., from waste trays, including these and from components in the lube oil system to lube oil waste tank, including this. Combined air and drain pipes, e.g. from lube oil coolers to lube oil waste tank or to system oil tank/system oil spare tank (Note! see also Ref.). Lube oil transfer system for tank refilling and removal of oil to different tanks, including such as: - Filling pipes to lube oil tanks (Note! see also Ref.) and possible bunkering hoses. - Piping from main engine lube oil pump to deck, with branching to system oil tank "dirty" and "clean", including these, and piping  further to system oil tanks and waste oil tanks (Note! see also Ref.). - Piping to/from lube oil separator, as well as piping to gland flange for connection to fuel oil separators. Also included are heating coils in the above mentioned lube oil tanks, as well as common piping, loose common tanks, etc. for various consumers; lube oil pipes which are common for consumers mentioned in the following subgroups.

@value.label: Lo purification plants
@value.definition: Plants for purification and treatment of lubricating oil (in the ship's main lube oil systems), including such as: - Lube oil separators with pumps, including drive units, valves, preheaters, etc. and/or plants for filtering, washing and portioning of additives (corresponding equipment and piping system as described in subgroup 702). - Piping with valves, etc. to sludge tank (Note! see also Ref.).

@id: 713 LO Systems for Propulsion Machinery and Transmissions

@value.label: Lo systems for propulsion machinery and transmissions
@value.definition: Lubricating oil systems for propulsion machinery and transmissions (for machinery in groups 60, 61, 62 and 63), including following systems: - Lube oil system (system oil) for propulsion diesel engines with piping, clamps, etc., from system oil tank to pumps, including these and possible separate evacuating plant, and further to filters and coolers, including these and possible preheater for starting, as well as piping to engines and back to system oil (sump) tank. If the system oil is also used for piston cooling, the lubrication is considered to be the main function and possible extra piping, etc. for this cooling pur- pose come under this subgroup (Note! see also Ref.). - Separate lube oil system for camshaft(s), including piping to and from propulsion machinery to camshaft lube oil tank with pumps, filters, valves, etc. - Lube oil system for cylinders including cylinder oil tank, cylinder oil day tank, as well as piping, etc. to the cylinders, sep- arate lube oil system for crossheads, with separate lube oil pump, loose tanks, piping etc. - Lube oil system for turbochargers for propulsion engines, including piping from turbine lube oil tank to collector tank and further to filters, coolers, and gravitation tank, including these. Piping from gravitation tank to turbochargers, as well as return pipes to collector tanks. - Lube oil system for other propulsion machinery (e.g. for bearings, etc. in propulsion turbines), with corresponding com- ponents as stated above.

@value.label: Lo systems for motor/turbo aggregates
@value.definition: Lubricating oil systems for motor aggregates, turbo aggregates, etc. (machinery in groups 65 and 66), including following systems: - System for H.D. oil or equivalent lubrication oil, with tank, piping with clamps, valves, etc., to motor aggregates, includ- ing separate lube oil pumps with drive unit, filters and coolers (Note! see also Ref.). - Emptying pipes with valves, etc. to lube oil waste tank or to common piping (Note! see also Ref.), as well as branch pipes with valves, etc. connecting main engine oil system.

@id: 715 LO System for Gas Gen., Common LO System for Other Machinery

@value.label: Lo system for gas gen., common lo system for other machinery
@value.definition: Lubricating oil systems for separate gas generators for propulsion gas turbines, etc. (machinery in group 64 and possibly in group 67), as well as for machinery not included in primary group 6, which is supplied by the same systems as the stated machinery, e.g. for bearings in reduction gears and turbines (placed in engine room) for loading and discharging pumps (Note! see also Ref.). The lube oil systems include piping from tanks in subgroup 711, or from branch points on common pipes, to the machinery, as well as return pipes, complete with all system components, such as valves, filters, loose tanks, pumps with drive unit, etc. Also included are central lube oil system for deck machinery, with all associated system components (Note! see also Ref.), as well as possible common lube oil system for machinery in more than one subgroup, with all associated system com- ponents.
references: 402 Rudder Carriers, Rudder Stocks, Rudder Bearings
36 FREEZING, REFRIGERATING AND HEATING SYSTEMS FOR CARGO

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Cooling systems
@value.definition: The group includes the ship's main cooling systems, i.e. systems for supply of sea water, fresh water and possibly other cooling media, to machinery main components (machinery in primary group 6) and to other machinery supplied by the same systems (Note! see also Ref.). The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). The systems in the subgroups include all associated system components, such as: - Pumps with drive units, coolers, loose tanks, (e.g. inspection and expansion tanks), etc. - Pipes with bends, T-pieces, flanges, suspensions, clamps, penetration pieces, filters, insulation with lining, etc. - Valves with spindle extension or separate hydraulic valve control system. - Local instruments (thermometers, manometers, etc.). - Protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds/tanks). - Spare parts. Drain pipes and pots, air and sounding pipes, valves with equipment, come under the subgroup for the component or sys- tem which is drained/ventilated (see also Ref.). All auxiliary systems (connected systems) end at the intake flange on the system which is described in the subgroup. Heat exchangers come under the primary system (e.g. lube oil coolers, refer to lube oil system).
references: 57 VENTILATION, AIR CONDITIONING AND HEATING SYSTEMS
262 Bottom Plugs, Sea Chests, Bilge Wells, Water Jet Intake
797 Automation Equipment for Other Machinery Components
448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables
813 Fire/Wash Down System, Emergency Fire Pumps, Sprinkler System
376 Inert Gas Systems with Conditioning Plant
384 Separate Cooling Water Systems for Cargo Equipment

@value.label: Sw cooling systems
@value.definition: Main sea water cooling systems for supply to machinery main components (machinery in primary group 6) and to mis- cellaneous machinery/equipment (Note! See also Ref.). The systems include sea water piping for cooling, such as suction pipes from sea chests and high suctions to pumps and pressure pipes to such as the following: - Scavenging air cooler and nozzle cooler for propulsion engines. - Condensers (also scoop arrangements for main condenser). - Gas turbines for propulsion. - Bearings. - Motor/turbo aggregates. - Fresh water generator. - Lube oil coolers (Note! see also Ref.). - Fresh water coolers (e.g. in main fresh water cooling system). - Compressors. - Coolers for air conditioning and provision rooms. - Scrubbers for inert gas plant (Note! see also Ref.). Return piping from the above mentioned components and equipment, as well as overboard piping.

@value.label: Fw and other cooling systems
@value.definition: Main fresh water cooling systems and cooling systems with other media (Note! not sea water) for supply to machinery main components (machinery in primary group 6) and to miscellaneous machinery/equipment (Note! see also Ref.). The fresh water cooling systems include suction pipes and pressure pipes to such as: - Nozzles, cylinder linings, etc. on propulsion machinery. - Other propulsion machinery and transmissions. - Motor/turbo generators. - Fresh water generator. - Coolers. - Condensers. Return piping from the above mentioned components and equipment, as well as overboard piping. The systems include all system components, such as pipes, fittings, valves with spindle extensions or separate hydraulic valve control system (Note! see also Ref.), main fresh water coolers (for cooling of the system water), pumps with drive units, loose tanks, etc. Cooling systems with other coolants for corresponding cooling functions as above mentioned, as for instance: - Cooling system with fuel oil, for nozzles. - Leaking water separator for drainage of leaking water from main engine packing boxes. - Flush-down arrangement for internal flushing of main engine. - Cooling system with special oil (Note! not system oil,) for pistons. The systems include all associated system components such as pipes, valves, heat exchangers (e.g. nozzle cooler), pumps with drive units (e.g. nozzle cooling pump), loose tanks (e.g. nozzle cooling tank), etc.
