@value.label: Compressed air systems
@value.definition: The group includes the ship's main compressed air systems, i.e. systems for production, storage and supply of compressed air to machinery main components (machinery in primary group 6) and to other machinery supplied by the same system (Note! see also Ref.), as well as supply of general purpose and instrument air. The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). The systems in the subgroups include all associated system components, such as: - Compressors with drive unit, coolers, loose tanks, filters and traps, drying equipment, sound mufflers, etc. - Pipes with bends, T-pieces, flanges, suspensions, clamps, expansion arrangements, penetration pieces, drain taps, valves, etc. - Local instruments (thermometers, manometers, etc.). - Protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds/tanks). - Spare parts. Drain pipes and pots, air pipes and valves, come under the subgroup for the component or system which is drained/blown- off. All auxiliary systems (connected systems) end at the intake flange on the system which is described in the subgroup.
references: 326 Pneumatic Plants for Bulk Cargo Handling
316 Protection Plates, Covers, Hatch Tents and Tarpaulins

@value.label: Starting air systems (high pressure)
@value.definition: System for production, storage and supply of starting and manoeuvring air (high-pressure air), to such as: - Propulsion diesel engines. - Auxiliary engines. - Boiler/soot-blower. - Reduction valves for low-pressure air system (Note! see also Ref.). - High-pressure whistle, etc. (Note! see also Ref.). The production plant includes such as: - Starting and emergency compressor with separate drive units, oil/water separators, coolers, etc. - Starting air tanks and bottles with melting plugs, valves, etc. If the emergency compressor is connected to drive unit for emergency fire pump or harbour/emergency generator, only the emergency compressor with couplings is to be entered here. Supply system for high-pressure air, including such as: - Pipes with bends, valves, etc., from compressors to tanks and from tanks to the above mentioned high-pressure con- sumers. - Drain pipes from the high-pressure air system to sinks. If general purpose air or instrument air is taken from the high-pressure system (starting air system) via branching and reduction valves, the high pressure system ends at the reduction valves (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 427 Light and Signal Equipment, Lanterns, Typhoons
505 Loose Firefighting Apparatuses and Equipment, Firemen's Outfit
732 General Purpose Air Systems for Engine Room (Low Pressure)
813 Fire/Wash Down System, Emergency Fire Pumps, Sprinkler System
733 General Purpose Air Systems for Deck (Low Pressure)

@id: 732 General Purpose Air Systems for Engine Room (Low Pressure)

@value.label: General purpose air systems for engine room (low pressure)
@value.definition: General purpose air system (low-pressure system) for supply to taps and equipment in engine room (and in adjoining work- shops and rooms for machinery), such as: - Cranes. - Engine tools. - Filters. - Tanks, etc. The system includes such as:

@id: 733 General Purpose Air Systems for Deck (Low Pressure)

@value.label: General purpose air systems for deck (low pressure)
@value.definition: General purpose air system (low-pressure system) for production, storage and supply of compressed air to taps and equip- ment on weather decks, on mast houses/superstructure and in possible other rooms outside the engine room (Note! see also Ref.), such as: - Cranes. - Davit winches, and other pneumatic winches. - Low-pressure whistles, etc. (Note! see also Ref.). The system includes such as: - General purpose air compressor (stationary and/or portable) with drive unit, oil and water separators, coolers, etc. - General purpose air tanks with melting plugs, etc. - Pipes with valves, taps, etc., from general purpose air tanks, or from branching points in the high-pressure system (including reduction valves), to the mentioned low-pressure consumers outside the engine room. - Drain pipes from the general purpose air system outside the engine room. If instrument air is taken from the general purpose air system via branching and reduction valves, the general purpose air system ends at the reduction valves (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 732 General Purpose Air Systems for Engine Room (Low Pressure)

@value.label: Instrument air supply systems
@value.definition: Supply system, as well as possible plant for production and storage of compressed air, to instruments and regulating devices (air which is usually dried and purified). The instrument air system (supply air system, control air system), includes such as: - Instrument air compressors with drive units, oil/water separators (drying and purification equipment), coolers, etc. - Instrument air tanks and bottles with melting plugs, etc. - Pipes with bends, valves, etc., from the above mentioned instrument air production machinery, as well as between com- ponents in this, or from branching points/tanks in the starting air/general purpose air system (including reduction valves) to instruments and regulating devices (Note! see also Ref.). - Drain pipes from components in the system.
references: 381 Sounding, Surveillance and Operating Equipment for Cargo Systems

@value.label: Exhaust systems and air intakes
@value.definition: This group includes the ship's main exhaust gas and air intake systems, i.e. exhaust and air intake systems for machinery main components (machinery in primary group 6). The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). The systems in the subgroups include all associated system components, such as: - Fans with drive units, muffler, filters, spark arresters, water separators, etc. - Pipes and ducts with bends, T-pieces, flanges, suspensions, clamps, expansion arrangements, penetration pieces, insu- lation with lining,etc. - Local instruments (thermometers, manometers, etc.). - Protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds/tanks). - Chemical additive equipment for cleaning of exhaust ducts. - Spare parts. All auxiliary systems connected systems) end at the intake flange on the system which is described in the subgroup.
references: 375 Blow-Off System from Safety Valves (Pressure/Vacuum Valves)
448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables
376 Inert Gas Systems with Conditioning Plant

@value.label: Fresh air intakes (not ventilation
@value.definition: Fresh air intakes from open air/top casing to machinery main components (machinery in primary group 6), such as: - Diesel engines. - Gas turbines. - Boilers. The systems include pipes/ducts, flap valves, defrosting plant, possible separate, extra fan with drive unit. (Note! see also Ref.), filters, etc.
references: 57 VENTILATION, AIR CONDITIONING AND HEATING SYSTEMS

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@id: 743 Exhaust Gas Systems for Propulsion Machinery

@value.label: Exhaust gas systems for propulsion machinery
@value.definition: Exhaust gas systems for machinery main components in groups 60, 61 and 62 (propulsion machinery), such as: - Exhaust gas system for diesel engines with ducts from turbochargers/exhaust gas receivers via exhaust gas boiler to open air, or direct to open air, as well as possible branch piping with exchange valve from main exhaust duct to/from exhaust gas boiler (by-pass). - Exhaust gas system for gas turbines including ducts with insulation, etc., from gas turbines/recuperators, direct to open air or via exhaust gas boiler to open air.
references: 621 Gas Turbines with Air Preheaters for Propulsion
376 Inert Gas Systems with Conditioning Plant

@id: 744 Exhaust Gas Systems for Motor Aggregates

@value.label: Exhaust gas systems for motor aggregates
@value.definition: Exhaust gas systems for machinery main components in groups 65 and 66 (electric power producing machinery), such as: - Exhaust gas system for motor aggregates (motor generators) including ducts with insulation, etc. from tur- bocharger/receiver to open air (Note! see also Ref.). - Exhaust gas system for gas turbo aggregates (turbo generators) with ducts, etc., to open air.
references: 376 Inert Gas Systems with Conditioning Plant

@value.label: Exhaust gas systems for boilers
@value.definition: Exhaust gas systems for machinery main components in group 64 (boilers, etc.),such as: - Exhaust gas system for fired boilers including ducts with insulation, etc. from boiler top/air preheater/economizer to open air. - Exhaust gas system for the fired part of a combined fired boiler/exhaust gas boiler with ducts from boiler to open air (Note! see also Ref.). - Exhaust gas system for separate gas generators with ducts from these to propulsion gas turbines. Here is also included equipment for mounted vessel/container for cleaning of slag (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 743 Exhaust Gas Systems for Propulsion Machinery
376 Inert Gas Systems with Conditioning Plant

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Ash/slag handling systems
@value.definition: System for handling ash/slag - fly-ash, heavy ash/slag from boiler grating and slag ash from burning of solid fuel such as e.g. coal. Ash/slag handling system could be pneumatic, hydraulic (water/ejector) or mechanical (conveyor belt) and consists of such as: System for handling and transport of heavy ash/slag from boiler grating (see Ref.) and over board, with silo, crusher, ash separator, storage silo, filter unit, ventilator etc., and pipelines/ducts between above mentioned and over board including pumps/fans/ejectors/machinery with drive unit. Part system for handling and transport of fly ash from cyclone/separator (including this) in exhaust gas system (See Ref.) and over board with similar components as mentioned in above mentioned system. Part system for handling and transport of slag ash from boiler to silo, including this, and further over board or back to the boiler, with separate fan including drive unit, ducts/pipelines etc. (See also Ref.). Auxiliary systems for last mentioned, part system only, such as separate water system for ejectors with pumps, including drive unit, compressed air systems with compressors/fans with drive units, vacuum pumps with drive unit units, etc.
references: 797 Automation Equipment for Other Machinery Components

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@id: 75 STEAM, CONDENSATE AND FEED WATER SYSTEMS

@value.label: Steam, condensate and feed water systems
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated:

@value.label: Primary full pressure steam systems
@value.definition: System for supply of primary steam (superheated and/or not superheated steam) with full (highest) outgoing boiler pres- sure (Note! not steam from such as steam converters). The system includes steam piping with valves, insulation, etc., from boiler to reduction/distribution centrals (junctions) or consumers, such as: - Steam propulsion turbines. - Turbo generators. - Loading and discharging pumps. - Heat exchangers, ejectors, glands, etc., which are supplied with full pressure steam. - Feed water pumps.
references: 752 Primary Reduced Pressure Steam Systems in Engine Room
75 STEAM, CONDENSATE AND FEED WATER SYSTEMS

@id: 752 Primary Reduced Pressure Steam Systems in Engine Room

@value.label: Primary reduced pressure steam systems in engine room
@value.definition: Systems which supply consumers in the engine room with primary steam at reduced pressure (Note! not steam from such as steam converters). The following types of system plants with pipes, valves (as well as reduction valves), insulation etc., are included: - Primary steam system with reduced pressure from distribution centrals (junctions), including these, to consumers in the engine room (in diesel engine driven ships), such as: o Preheaters for water, oil, etc. o Heating coils in engine room (Note! see also Ref.). o Heat exchangers for ventilation plants. o Separators. o Main engine (heating). o Burners/soot blowers. o Sea water intakes in engine room (de-icing). o Consumers in turbine driven ships can, for instance be pumps, ejectors, preheaters, deaerators, etc. Back-pressure steam system and steam bleeder system - primary systems usually only in turbine driven ships - including such as: - Piping from turbines for feed water pumps and to other consumers. - Piping from bleeding points on propulsion turbine to low-pressure preheaters, high-pressure preheaters, fresh water generator, etc.
references: 757 Secondary Steam Systems in Engine Room
753 Primary Reduced Pressure Systems Outside Engine Room
365 Indirect Cooling/Heating Systems, Cargo Oil Heating
754 Primary Drain, Blow-Off, Exhaust Steam and Deaeration System in Engine Room

@id: 753 Primary Reduced Pressure Systems Outside Engine Room

@value.label: Primary reduced pressure systems outside engine room
@value.definition: Systems which supply the consumers outside the engine room with primary steam at reduced pressure (Note! not steam from such as steam converters), as well as miscellaneous associated auxiliary systems. The following types of systems with pipes, valves, (also reduction valves), insulation, etc. are included: - Primary steam system with reduced pressure from distribution centrals (junctions), including these, to consumers out- side the engine room, such as: o Heating coils in tanks outside the engine room (Note! see also Ref.). o Pumps, ejectors, etc. o Winches. o Equipment in galley. o Heating cabinets in ventilation plants. o Equipment in engine casing. o Sea water intakes outside engine room (de-icing). o Whistles, etc. Hoses for steam supply from land with couplings, etc. Exhaust steam and drain systems from the above mentioned consumers to atmospheric condensers/condensate tanks. Blow-off and air piping from components in the above mentioned reduced-pressure system.
references: 365 Indirect Cooling/Heating Systems, Cargo Oil Heating
754 Primary Drain, Blow-Off, Exhaust Steam and Deaeration System in Engine Room

@id: 754 Primary Drain, Blow-Off, Exhaust Steam and Deaeration System in Engine Room

@value.label: Primary drain, blow-off, exhaust steam and deaeration system in engine room
@value.definition: Auxiliary systems in the engine room connected to the ship’s primary steam plant (Note! not connected to such as steam converters), including the following types of systems: Drain pipes with valves, etc., from all components in the engine room, connected to the primary steam plant, to con- densate tanks. Exhaust steam system (Note! see also Ref.) from consumers in the engine room (those supplied with primary steam) to condensers, i.e. from consumers such as: - Turbines for cargo pumps. - Turbo aggregates. - Propulsion turbines. - Blow-off/overflow and air piping from boilers and components in the primary steam plant, in the engine room.
references: 757 Secondary Steam Systems in Engine Room
817 Fire Fighting Systems with Steam and Water Spraying
758 Secondary Steam Systems Outside Engine Room
753 Primary Reduced Pressure Systems Outside Engine Room

@value.label: Primary condensate systems
@value.definition: Condensate system for the ship's primary steam system (Note! not secondary condensate system, e.g. for the steam con- verter). The primary condensate system is limited by condensers/condensate tanks and the feed water pumps suction side (high- pressure pumps) and includes such as: - Condensers (vacuum and atmospheric and/or waste steam condensers) with air suction aggregate (Note! see also Ref.). - Deaerators (air/water separators). - Loose tanks for condensate, such as inspection tank, filter tank, feed/preparation tanks, etc. - Condensate pumps (low-pressure) and possible circulating pumps with drive units. - Condensate preheater (low-pressure). - Pipes with valves and system components between condenser and condensate tanks and further to feed water pumps - high-pressure pumps - (Note! see also Ref.). Also included here are piping and equipment for adding of chemicals to the condensate system, as well as possible equip- ment for purification of the condensate. In the primary condensate system is also included saw dust injector for the main condenser.
references: 759 Secondary Condensate and Feed Water Systems
754 Primary Drain, Blow-Off, Exhaust Steam and Deaeration System in Engine Room

@id: 755025 First Stage LP Feed Water Heaters

@value.label: First stage lp feed water heaters

@id: 755027 Second Stage LP Feed Water Heaters

@value.label: Second stage lp feed water heaters
Primary feed water systems
@value.definition: Feed water system for the ship's primary steam plant (note! not secondary feed water system, e.g. for the steam con- verter). The primary feed water system is limited by the feed water pumps suction side (high-pressure pumps) and the boiler(s), and includes such as: - Feed water pumps (high-pressure) with drive units, as well as injectors. - Feed water preheaters (high-pressure). - Piping with valves, etc., between the feed water pumps and the high pressure preheaters to the boiler(s). Also included here are possible water circulation system between auxiliary fired boilers and exhaust gas boiler with pipes, circulation pumps, etc. Piping and equipment for portioning chemical additives in the feed water system (high-pressure system), as well as pos- sible equipment for purification of the feed water are also included.
references: 759 Secondary Condensate and Feed Water Systems

@id: 756015 First Stage HP Feed Water Heaters

@value.label: First stage hp feed water heaters

@id: 756017 Second Stage HP Feed Water Heaters

@value.label: Second stage hp feed water heaters

@id: 757 Secondary Steam Systems in Engine Room

@value.label: Secondary steam systems in engine room
@value.definition: System which supplies consumers in the engine room with secondary steam (e.g. from steam converter) as well as mis- cellaneous associated auxiliary systems (Note! not systems connected to the ship's primary steam plant). The following types of systems with pipes, valves, insulation, etc., are included: - Secondary steam system from steam converter (or similar) to consumers in the engine room, such as: o Preheaters for water, oil, etc. o Heating coils in tanks in the engine room (Note! see also Ref.). o Steam-driven pumps, ejectors, etc. Exhaust steam system and drain system from the above mentioned consumers and components in the secondary systems in engine room to condensers/condensate tanks. Blow-off/overflow and air piping from steam converter and components in the secondary systems in the engine room.
references: 758 Secondary Steam Systems Outside Engine Room
752 Primary Reduced Pressure Steam Systems in Engine Room
759 Secondary Condensate and Feed Water Systems

@id: 758 Secondary Steam Systems Outside Engine Room

@value.label: Secondary steam systems outside engine room
@value.definition: System which supplies consumers outside the engine room with secondary steam (e.g. from steam converter), as well as miscellaneous associated auxiliary systems (Note! not systems connected to the ship's primary steam plant). The following types of systems with pipes, valves, insulation, etc., are included: - Secondary steam system from steam converter (or similar) to consumers outside the engine room, such as: o Heating coil in tanks outside the engine room (Note! see also Ref.). o Ventilation cabinets. o Equipment in galley. o Steam-driven pumps, ejectors, etc. o Preheaters, etc. Exhaust steam and drain systems from the above mentioned consumers and components in the secondary systems, out- side the engine room, to condensers/condensate tanks. Blow-off/overflow and air piping from components in the secondary systems outside the engine room.
references: 757 Secondary Steam Systems in Engine Room
753 Primary Reduced Pressure Systems Outside Engine Room
365 Indirect Cooling/Heating Systems, Cargo Oil Heating

@id: 759 Secondary Condensate and Feed Water Systems

@value.label: Secondary condensate and feed water systems
@value.definition: Condensate and feed water systems for the ship's secondary steam plant, e.g. for the steam converter, (Note! not con- densate and feed water systems for the primary steam system). The secondary condensate and feed water systems are limited by condensers/condensate tanks and steam converter (or similar) and include such as:

@value.label: Distilled and make-up water systems
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and control (in workshops and during installation). The subgroups include all associated system components, such as: - Pumps with drive units, loose tanks (e.g. make-up water tank), etc. - Pipes with bends, T-pieces, flanges, etc., valves, filters, suspensions, clamps, penetration pieces, insulation with lining, etc. - Local instruments (thermometers, manometers, etc.). - Protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds/tanks). - Spare parts. Drain pipes and pots, air pipes, valves and sounding pipes with equipment, come under the subgroup for the component or system which is drained/deaerated (Note! See also Ref.). All auxiliary systems (connected systems) end at the intake flange on the system described in the subgroup.
references: 797 Automation Equipment for Other Machinery Components
316 Protection Plates, Covers, Hatch Tents and Tarpaulins
448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables

@value.label: Fw production system
@value.definition: Distilled and make-up water systems, including such as: - Fresh water generator with equipment, flanges, etc. for connection to sea water, fresh water and possible steam sys- tem (the condenser and evaporator side), vacuum pump with drive unit etc. - Separate sea water pump with suction and pressure piping, including valves, clamps, etc. to the fresh water generator. - Brine pipes with valves, etc. from the fresh water generator to brine ejector/pump (including this) and overboard. - Separate sea water pump with suction and pressure piping, including valves, etc. to brine ejector.

@value.label: Technical fw system
@value.definition: Distribution for technical fresh water systems, including pumps, pipes, etc.

@value.label: Automation systems for machinery
@value.definition: The group includes equipment and systems of electrical, electronic, pneumatic and/or hydraulic types or combinations of these, for the functions: - Manoeuvring/control (remote and programmed control). - Regulating/automatic control. - Indicating and recording. - Monitoring (alarm and safety). The group includes automation systems for machinery in primary group 6, as well as for machinery and systems in the engine room (Note! see also Ref.) and in primary groups 7 and 8, unless otherwise stated. The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated:

@value.label: Manoeuvring consoles, main consoles
@value.definition: Manoeuvring consoles (control consoles) and main consoles/panels (common cabinets, panels or similar for mounting of automation equipment belonging to more than one subgroup) in control room/engine room and on bridge, for installation of automation components for machinery in engine room and for other machinery in primary groups 6, 7 and possibly 8, as well as for installation of possible navigation and/or communication equipment, etc. (Note! see also Ref.). The subgroup also includes such as: Junction materials, name plates/signs, as well as work concerning mounting and connection of the instruments and equip- ment in the consoles/panels. Small and cheap components in the consoles/panels i.e. signal lamps, push buttons, etc. Heating elements, etc., to prevent condensation, as well as equipment to obstruct dust and oil penetration into the con- soles/panels. Common instruments and equipment in the consoles/panels which do not directly belong to the following subgroups in group. 79 or in other subgroups (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 381 Sounding, Surveillance and Operating Equipment for Cargo Systems
792 Common Automation Equipment, Engine Room Alarm Systems
403 Steering Gear/Columns, Telemoter, Rudder Indicator, Emergency Steering

@id: 792 Common Automation Equipment, Engine Room Alarm Systems

@value.label: Common automation equipment, engine room alarm systems
@value.definition: Common automation equipment for the following subgroups in group 79, including equipment such as: - Components in the engine room alarm system such as A/D converters, time indicators, alarm central, control unit, pan- els in engine room/control room, on bridge and possibly in cabins, etc. (including components in the alarm calling sys- tem), alarm printer, alarm executants (sirens and lights), etc. (Note! see also Ref.). - Common data loggers i.e., data loggers which are common for more than one of the following subgroups in group 79, and/or are common for automation plants for cargo and automation plants in group 79, with possible separate scanner and alarm components. - EDP plant for the automation functions (control, recording, alarm, etc.), for machinery in engine room, as well as for other machinery in primary groups 6, 7 and 8, including such as computer (central processing unit, memory, etc.) input/output equipment (interface equipment, selectors, A/D converters, etc.), other peripheral equipment (printers, punchers, real time clock, band stations, drums, etc.) and other equipment which is special for the EDP plant. - TV-sets with associated equipment, for supervision of rooms. - Batteries (separate spare/stand by power source) for automation equipment is posted on this subgroup.
references: 381 Sounding, Surveillance and Operating Equipment for Cargo Systems
792 Common Automation Equipment, Engine Room Alarm Systems
811 Fire Detection, Fire and Lifeboat Alarm Systems
815 Fire Fighting Systems with Gas (CO2, Halon, etc.)
882 Cable Trays with Installation in Accommodation
798 Cables/Leads and Piping for Automation Systems for Machinery

@id: 793 Automation Equipment, Prop. Machinery and Transmission, Engine Telegraph

@value.label: Automation equipment, prop. machinery and transmission, engine telegraph
@value.definition: Automation equipment for propulsion machinery and transmissions (for machinery in groups 60, 61, 62 and 63), as well as engine telegraph, including such as: - Equipment for remote start/stop and manoeuvring (control) as well as for programmed starting/control of the propul- sion machinery (diesel engines, turbines with main condenser, etc.) and transmissions (controllable pitch propeller plant, couplings, etc.), including regulation and safety equipment. - Engine telegraph with transmitter on the bridge and receiver in the engine room, including bracket, printer, separate alarm, etc. - Equipment for indicating and recording of pressure, temperature in systems for instance in bearings (measuring on/by the mentioned machinery for condition control), as well as of runs per minute, direction of rotation, propeller pitch, shaft power, etc. - Sensors with muffs, etc. on propulsion machinery and transmissions, for recording, indications, alarm, etc., are also included.
references: 793 Automation Equipment, Prop. Machinery and Transmission, Engine Telegraph
792 Common Automation Equipment, Engine Room Alarm Systems
797 Automation Equipment for Other Machinery Components
798 Cables/Leads and Piping for Automation Systems for Machinery

@value.label: Automation equipment for boilers
@value.definition: Automation equipment for machinery in group 64 (for main boilers, large auxiliary boilers, etc.) including boiler and burner automation equipment such as: - Equipment for start and stop and remote control, as well as for programmed control of the boilers and burners, includ- ing equipment for regulation (of level in boiler drum and other possible feed water regulations, combustion quantity and quality, steam temperature, etc.), and safety systems (by low-level in boiler drum, stop of boiler fan, flame cut- out, etc.). - Equipment for indicating and recording of pressure, temperature, level, etc. (measuring on/by the boilers, etc. for con- dition control). - Sensors with muffs, etc., on the boiler for recording, indication, alarm, etc., are also included.
references: 792 Common Automation Equipment, Engine Room Alarm Systems
797 Automation Equipment for Other Machinery Components
798 Cables/Leads and Piping for Automation Systems for Machinery

@value.label: Automation equipment for motor/turbo aggregates
@value.definition: Automation equipment for motor aggregates, turbo aggregates, etc. (for machinery in groups 65 and 66), including such as: - Equipment for remote start/stop and manoeuvring (control) as well as for programmed control of the generators' drive units (diesel engines and turbine automation equipment), including regulation and safety equipment. - Equipment for automatic synchronizing, phasing in, magnetizing and load shearing, as well as possible other auto- mation equipment for generators and for general electrical supply, are also included (Note! see also Ref.). - Equipment for indication and recording of pressure, temperature, etc.,(measuring on/by the motor aggregates, etc., for condition control) as well as for runs per minute, effect, etc. Sensors with muffs, etc., on the motor aggregates, etc. for recording, indication, alarm, etc., are also included.
references: 881 Cable Trays and Installation in Engine and Boiler Rooms
792 Common Automation Equipment, Engine Room Alarm Systems
797 Automation Equipment for Other Machinery Components
798 Cables/Leads and Piping for Automation Systems for Machinery

@id: 796 Automation Equipment for Nuclear Reactor Plants

@value.label: Automation equipment for nuclear reactor plants
@value.definition: Automation equipment for nuclear reactor plant (for machinery in group 67), including equipment for the automation func- tions defined in group 79's general text.
references: 797 Automation Equipment for Other Machinery Components

@id: 797 Automation Equipment for Other Machinery Components

@value.label: Automation equipment for other machinery components
@value.definition: Automation equipment for machinery in the engine room other than that which is covered by the other subgroups in group 79, for systems in the engine room (see also Ref.) and also in primary group 7 and 8 unless otherwise noted, including such as: - Equipment for remote start/stop and manoeuvring (control) as well as programmed start-up of pumps, fans, sep- arators, compressors, etc. - Equipment for regulating and securing of same, also for control, etc, of viscosity, valves, etc, in a control loop, including sensors, controllers etc (see also Ref.). - Equipment for indication and recording of pressures, temperatures, positions, levels (such as equipment for remote sounding of fuel and lube oil tanks, ballast and other water tanks etc), viscosity etc (measuring in systems/on machinery for condition control). - Sensors with muffs, etc, in systems/on machinery for surveillance (alarms). The subgroup includes automation equipment with primary function to serve the machinery covered by this subgroup (and thus only has a secondary influence on the machinery covered by other subgroups in group 79).
references: 381 Sounding, Surveillance and Operating Equipment for Cargo Systems
798 Cables/Leads and Piping for Automation Systems for Machinery
792 Common Automation Equipment, Engine Room Alarm Systems
811 Fire Detection, Fire and Lifeboat Alarm Systems
815 Fire Fighting Systems with Gas (CO2, Halon, etc.)
403 Steering Gear/Columns, Telemoter, Rudder Indicator, Emergency Steering

@id: 798 Cables/Leads and Piping for Automation Systems for Machinery

@value.label: Cables/leads and piping for automation systems for machinery
@value.definition: System for signal transmission between the automation components in the above subgroups in group 79, including such as: - Cables/leads. - Pneumatic and/or hydraulic pipes with fittings, etc. - Piping for hydraulic-drive (power) system where the hydraulic drive system only attends automation equipment in group 79, e.,g. piping in hydraulic-drive system (separate) for remote control of the propulsion machinery.
references: 381 Sounding, Surveillance and Operating Equipment for Cargo Systems
881 Cable Trays and Installation in Engine and Boiler Rooms
811 Fire Detection, Fire and Lifeboat Alarm Systems
815 Fire Fighting Systems with Gas (CO2, Halon, etc.)
403 Steering Gear/Columns, Telemoter, Rudder Indicator, Emergency Steering

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Common systems
@value.definition: Central ship systems, for example ballast and bilge systems, fire fighting and wash down systems, electrical distribution systems etc.

@id: 80 BALLAST AND BILGE SYSTEMS, GUTTER PIPES OUTSIDE ACCOMMODATION

@value.label: Ballast and bilge systems, gutter pipes outside accommodation
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). The systems in the subgroups include all associated system components, such as: - Pumps with drive units, ejectors, bilge water separator, etc. - Pipes with bends, T-pieces, flanges, suspension, clamps, penetration pieces, filters, etc. - Valves with spindle extensions or separate hydraulic valve control system, complete with drive units, transmissions, loose tanks, etc. - Local instruments (thermometers, manometers, etc.). - Protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds/tanks). - Spare parts. Drain and deaeration pipes with valves, etc. (for systems/components) come under the subgroup for the component or sys- tem which is drained/deaerated. (Note! see also Ref.). All auxiliary systems (connected systems) end at the intake flange in the system described in the subgroup.
references: 881 Cable Trays and Installation in Engine and Boiler Rooms
262 Bottom Plugs, Sea Chests, Bilge Wells, Water Jet Intake
448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables

@value.label: Ballast systems, solid ballast
@value.definition: Systems for water filling/emptying of all ballast tanks and/or combined ballast/fuel oil tanks (Note! see also Ref.), includ- ing such as: - Suction pipes with valves, including spindle extensions or corresponding, clamps, etc., from sea water intake/tanks to pumps, including these, and pressure pipes to the tanks and overboard, as well as connection pipes to bilge systems. Here is also included drop valves in ballast tanks (e.g. top wing tanks), and evacuating system for ballast pumps with vacuum pumps including drive unit, separator tank, vacuum tank, control equipment, etc. If the same pumps are used both for the bilge and ballast systems, the pumps, including drive units, are to be entered here. Hydraulic valve control system for the ballast valves. If the system also operates the valves in the bilge system, the remote control of the ballast valves is considered to be the primary function, and the hydraulic valve control system , complete with drive units, possible loose tanks, transmissions etc., is to be entered here (note! see also Ref.). Separate equipment and systems for cleaning of ballast water with measuring equipment interface detector, ballast water separator, alternative filtering system, piping with valves, possible loose tanks, etc. Casting of the solid ballast, as well as the preparation work, is also included here.
references: 381 Sounding, Surveillance and Operating Equipment for Cargo Systems
402 Rudder Carriers, Rudder Stocks, Rudder Bearings
797 Automation Equipment for Other Machinery Components
52 INTERNAL DECK COVERING, LADDERS, STEPS, RAILING

@id: 801047 Hydr. Oil Pumps with Drive Units

@value.label: Hydr. oil pumps with drive units
Heating coils in ballast tanks
@value.definition: Heating coils in ballast tanks, including possible connection pipes.
references: 84 CENTRAL HEAT TRANSFER SYSTEMS WITH CHEMICAL FLUIDS/OIL
75 STEAM, CONDENSATE AND FEED WATER SYSTEMS
365 Indirect Cooling/Heating Systems, Cargo Oil Heating

@value.label: Bilge systems
@value.definition: Systems for removal of bilge-water from all rooms and cofferdams, including such as: - Suction pipes with valves, including spindle extensions or corresponding (Note! see also Ref.), clamps, etc., from bilge wells to bilge pumps/ejectors, (including these), and overboard or similar, as well as possible portable emergency bilge pump, are also included here. - Separate equipment and systems for cleaning of bilge water, with bilge water separator and/or filtering systems includ- ing piping with valves, possible loose tanks etc.
references: 381 Sounding, Surveillance and Operating Equipment for Cargo Systems
797 Automation Equipment for Other Machinery Components

@value.label: Gutter pipes outside accommodation
@value.definition: Gutter pipes (drain pipes/scuppers) outside accommodation from weather decks (also from awnings) and decks in: - Cargo holds. - Engine room. - Rooms in the fore body, etc. Pipes with clamps, possible valves, etc., as well as casting for gutters in fore/aft peak, etc., are included (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 267 Gutter Bars, Bulwark, Breakwaters, Gas Barriers

@value.label: Drainage from indoor cargo holds
@value.definition: Pipes, valves, etc.

@value.label: Condensate drain system
@value.definition: Pipes, valves, etc.

@value.label: Drainage from technical spares
@value.definition: Pipes, valves, etc.

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@id: 81 FIRE AND LIFEBOAT ALARM, FIRE FIGHTING AND WASH DOWN SYSTEMS

@value.label: Fire and lifeboat alarm, fire fighting and wash down systems
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). The systems in the subgroups include all associated system components, such as: - Pumps with drive units (Note! see also Ref.), loose tanks (bottles), etc. - Pipes with bends, T-pieces, flanges, suspensions, clamps, penetration pieces, diffusers, taps, filters, etc. - Hoses with couplings, drums and possible hose lockers. - Valves with spindle extensions/cord drives or separate hydraulic valve control system, complete with drive units, trans- missions, loose tanks, etc.

@id: 811 Fire Detection, Fire and Lifeboat Alarm Systems

@value.label: Fire detection, fire and lifeboat alarm systems
@value.definition: System for fire detection, fire and lifeboat alarm systems (general alarm),including such as: - Smoke and heat detectors with socket and cover. - Signal transmission leads with clamps, etc., from the detectors to central, including this, from alarm push-buttons, including these, to central and further, to alarms. Audible and visual alarms such as lamps and bells (also for fault- warning). - Separate battery with possible charger for fire detection/alarm, etc. Here is also included arrangement for combined fire alarm and remote operation/closing of watertight doors (integrated arrangement).
references: 792 Common Automation Equipment, Engine Room Alarm Systems
882 Cable Trays with Installation in Accommodation
815 Fire Fighting Systems with Gas (CO2, Halon, etc.)

@value.label: Emergency shutdown system
@value.definition: Centrally mounted fire damper control system.

@id: 813 Fire/Wash Down System, Emergency Fire Pumps, Sprinkler System

@value.label: Fire/wash down system, emergency fire pumps, sprinkler system
@value.definition: Systems for supply of fire extinguishing and/or wash down water, including such as: - Piping with valves, spindle extensions or corresponding equipment, equipment for land (shore) connection, taps, nozzles (for sprinkler system), etc. - Hoses with couplings, nozzles, drums and hose lockers. - Pressure tank (for class F). - Fire/wash down pumps with drive units. - General service pumps with drive unit. - Emergency fire pump with separate drive unit (or own hydraulic operating system, including machinery) and possible transmissions, possible separate starting battery and charging rectifier, as well as separate systems for drive unit, such as exhaust gas system, air suction system, fuel oil system, lube oil system, cooling water system, etc., complete with all system components (Note! see also Ref.). - If other machinery is mounted on the emergency fire pump drive unit (by e.g. hydraulic operation) the emergency fire pump is to be considered the main function and the drive unit (or the common hydraulic machinery) is to be charged to this group. Sprinkler system e.g. in accommodation, for tankers for cooling of decks over tanks/loose tanks, as well as sprinkler/wash down system for naval vessels, complete with associated system components, as described above.
references: 814 Fire Fighting Systems for External Fires

@id: 813031 Emergency Fire Pumps with Drive Units

@value.label: Emergency fire pumps with drive units

@id: 813053 Hydr. Oil Pumps with Drive Units

@value.label: Hydr. oil pumps with drive units

@id: 814 Fire Fighting Systems for External Fires

@value.label: Fire fighting systems for external fires
@value.definition: Systems primarily for extinguishing of external fires (fires outside the vessel) for e.g. salvage vessels, fire-fighting vessels, supply vessels and similar (Note! for fires onboard "own" vessel, the other subgroups in group 81, to be used). The fire-fighting system, with for example water and/or foam or similar, includes such as: - Fire pumps with drive units, e.g. diesel engines. - Separate systems and equipment for drive unit as e.g. fuel and lube oil systems, exhaust gas ducts, cooling water sys- tem etc., with separate piping, pumps, loose tanks and similar. - Foam tanks with valves etc., foam generator, foam mixing units. - Water- and foam guns with possible separate platforms, nozzles, hoses, hose-drums and lockers. - Piping with valves etc. from sea-chests, to pumps and further to cannons, nozzles, and possibly to sprinkler/wash down systems (Note! see also Ref.). - Arrangement for remote operation and aiming of guns (with valves etc.) and monitoring of the plant with separate con- trol desk, signal transmission cables, instruments/meters, etc.
references: 505 Loose Firefighting Apparatuses and Equipment, Firemen's Outfit
813 Fire/Wash Down System, Emergency Fire Pumps, Sprinkler System

@id: 815 Fire Fighting Systems with Gas (CO2, Halon, etc.)

@value.label: Fire fighting systems with gas (co halon, etc.)
@value.definition: Plants/systems for fire-fighting with gas, e.g. CO2, Halon and similar in such as: - Engine room - Pump room, side thruster room, etc. - Storage rooms. - Cargo tanks/-holds, etc. The systems include bottles/containers and bottle racks with equipment, pipes with nozzles, valves, fittings etc. from these to the mentioned rooms, possible system with suction fan to detectors (analysers) including these, on for example bridge, control panel, remote control arrangement and arrangement for (CO2) alarm with monitoring installation, signal trans- mission cables etc. and similar for connections to doors (including magnet closing arrangement etc. and e.g. fans). Here is also included separate refrigerating plants for gas fire extinguishing systems, with all system components con- cerned, pipes etc.
references: 505 Loose Firefighting Apparatuses and Equipment, Firemen's Outfit
811 Fire Detection, Fire and Lifeboat Alarm Systems
376 Inert Gas Systems with Conditioning Plant

@value.label: Fire fighting systems with foam
@value.definition: Stationary or portable plants (systems) for foam fire fighting, in/on such as: - Engine room. - Cargo tanks/holds. - Decks, etc. The systems include loose tanks, foam- and water pumps, foam guns (monitors) and pipes with fittings, valves, etc., from the tanks to the mentioned rooms/decks, as well as service/control equipment.
references: 505 Loose Firefighting Apparatuses and Equipment, Firemen's Outfit
813 Fire/Wash Down System, Emergency Fire Pumps, Sprinkler System
819 NO Pressurized Deluge System or Firefighting with Other Means

@id: 817 Fire Fighting Systems with Steam and Water Spraying

@value.label: Fire fighting systems with steam and water spraying
@value.definition: All separate piping for steam fire fighting in such as: - Engine room, pump rooms. - Separator room. - Cargo tanks, etc. The systems include separate pipes, with valves, insulation, etc., from the boiler or from branching points from common steam pipes to the mentioned room/tanks (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 75 STEAM, CONDENSATE AND FEED WATER SYSTEMS

@value.label: Fire fighting systems with powder
@value.definition: Fire fighting systems with powder, e.g., on deck on L.P.G. ships, including such as: - Powder containers, with valves, plugs, cleaning equipment, etc. - Control panel and compressed gas container. - Pipes for compressed gas and pipes/hoses for powder with nozzles, powder and possible guns and hose lockers. - Service and control equipment.
references: 505 Loose Firefighting Apparatuses and Equipment, Firemen's Outfit
819 NO Pressurized Deluge System or Firefighting with Other Means

@id: 819 NO Pressurized Deluge System or Firefighting with Other Means

@value.label: No pressurized deluge system or firefighting with other means
@value.definition: Systems for fire fighting onboard with other agents than mentioned in preceding subgroups and with more agents (com- bined plants). For example fire fighting systems with foam and powder. Here is included similar system components as mentioned in the other subgroups in group 81.

@id: 82 AIR AND SOUNDING SYSTEMS FROM TANKS TO DECK

@value.label: Air and sounding systems from tanks to deck
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). The system in the subgroups include all associated system components, such as: - Pipes with bends, clamps, penetration pieces, etc. - Spare parts, etc.
references: 448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables

@value.label: Bleed and overflow pipe systems
@value.definition: Air and sounding systems from tanks to deck (also combined air and overflow pipes), for tanks for water, fuel oil, lube oil, etc. (Note! see also Ref.) as well as for bilges and special rooms, e.g. cofferdams. The subgroup includes pipes from the tanks to open air, with flanges, valves, possible swan necks/air hoods and similar, etc., as well as plugs, sounding boxes, etc.
references: 381 Sounding, Surveillance and Operating Equipment for Cargo Systems
57 VENTILATION, AIR CONDITIONING AND HEATING SYSTEMS
304 Smaller Hatches, Grain Hatches, Manhole Covers
797 Automation Equipment for Other Machinery Components

@value.definition: Manual Sounding System.

@value.definition: Automatic/Remote Sounding System.

@value.label: Special common hydr. oil systems
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation).

@value.label: Special common hydr. oil systems
@value.definition: Hydraulic oil systems which serve special consumer combinations, e.g., hydraulic oil systems for machinery/equipment in more than one subgroup and which cannot be entered in other subgroups for frequent occurring common hydraulic oil sys- tems (Note! see also Ref.). The special common hydraulic oil systems can be for consumer combinations such as: - Loading/discharging pumps and side thrusters (bow propeller). - Mooring winches and side thruster. - Loading/discharging pumps/compressors, ballast pumps and mooring winches. - Winches for fishing, loading/discharging and mooring. - Propulsion propeller, generator, mooring winches, and e.g. winches for fishing and hunting. The special common hydraulic oil systems include such as: - Pumps with separate drive units, or driven by propulsion machinery, main reduction gear, etc., thus including coup- ling/V-belt transmissions own (separate) gears, mounted valves, etc. - Expansion tank and loose storage tanks with flanges, valves, etc. (Note! see also Ref.). - Cooling coils in the tanks or separate coolers. - Filling, sounding, deaeration and drain pipes for the tanks, etc. (Note! see also Ref.). - Piping between the mentioned components and supply piping to the mentioned machinery, as well as return piping. The system piping includes all system components, such as bends, T-pieces, flanges, filters, purification plant, drain taps, waste trays, etc. If the separate hydraulic oil systems have a common tank, the tank (if loose) with common equipment, comes under this subgroup.
references: 381 Sounding, Surveillance and Operating Equipment for Cargo Systems
438 Common Hydr. Oil System for Anchoring/Mooring Equipment
309 Common Hydraulic Oil System for Hatches/Ports
439 Common Hydr. Oil System for Anchoring/Mooring/Cargo Winches

@id: 84 CENTRAL HEAT TRANSFER SYSTEMS WITH CHEMICAL FLUIDS/OIL

@value.label: Central heat transfer systems with chemical fluids/oil
@value.definition: The group includes central heat transfer systems with chemical liquids (e.g. so-called heat oil/thermal oil system) primar- ily for heating of the ship's tanks, systems, accommodation, etc. If the heat oil system is also used (partly) for cooling, this is posted here. The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License- and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshop and during installation). The systems in the subgroups include all associated system components, such as: - Pumps with drive units, ejectors, loose tanks, etc. - Pipes and lines with bends, T-pieces, flanges, suspensions, penetration pieces, expansion arrangements, valves, filters, insulation, lining etc. - Local instruments (thermometers, manometers, and similar), regulating and control equipment, protection covers (excluding weather decks and cargo holds/tanks). - Spare parts. All auxiliary systems (connected systems) end at intake flanges in the system described in the subgroup.
references: 648 Central Heating and Thermal Oil Boilers
75 STEAM, CONDENSATE AND FEED WATER SYSTEMS
36 FREEZING, REFRIGERATING AND HEATING SYSTEMS FOR CARGO
384 Separate Cooling Water Systems for Cargo Equipment

@value.label: Heating oil treatment systems
@value.definition: System for treatment and heating of the chemical heat transfer liquid. This subgroup covers the part of heat oil system, that is between boiler (Note! see Ref.) and flanges for delivery- and return lines from the users. In heat oil treatment system is included such as: - Feed pumps with drive units. - Circulation pumps with drive units and possible circulator. - Expansion tank with mounted valves, gas pressure meter and similar. - De-gassing tank (including air pipe). - Storage tanks. - Flow-meter and -regulators and other local automation equipment (see also Ref.). - Piping with valves, filters, insulation etc. between mentioned system components and to/from oil fired and/or exhaust gas boiler (Note! see Ref.). Here is also included separate cooling water system for packing boxes and similar in e.g. heat oil circulation pumps, with own pump including drive unit, piping, etc.
references: 648 Central Heating and Thermal Oil Boilers
797 Automation Equipment for Other Machinery Components

@id: 842 Heating Oil Distribution Systems for Engine Room

@value.label: Heating oil distribution systems for engine room
@value.definition: System for distribution of chemical heat transfer liquid to users in engine room and in adjoining rooms such as: - Fuel and lube oil preheaters. - Heating coils in tanks in engine room. - Water heaters. - Heating of pumps. - Heating units for engine room, accommodation and similar. - Butterworth heat exchanger. - Steam generator, heat exchanger for steam production for fire extinguishing. The system includes supply and return piping from the users, with pipes, valves, insulation, local automation equipment etc. (Note! see also Ref.). Here is also included common pipelines for the users within and outside the engine room.
references: 843 Heating Oil Distribution Systems Outside Engine Room

@id: 843 Heating Oil Distribution Systems Outside Engine Room

@value.label: Heating oil distribution systems outside engine room
@value.definition: System for distribution of chemical heat transfer liquid to users outside engine room (and adjoining rooms) e.g. on outside deck, in cargo holds/tanks, other tanks in the cargo area, such as ballast- and bunker tanks. Here is included arrangement for heat oil supply and return piping to such as: - Cargo pipelines on deck and possibly in tanks. - Heating coils in cargo oil tanks, ballast tanks, bunker tanks and similar. - Heating units for cargo oil pumps and other users outside the engine room. In the system is included system components analogue to that mentioned in subgroup 842.
references: 842 Heating Oil Distribution Systems for Engine Room
365 Indirect Cooling/Heating Systems, Cargo Oil Heating

The EDP plant includes such as: - Control unit, memory, etc. - Input/output equipment (interface equipment, selectors, AD-converters, etc). - Other peripheral equipment (for printing, reading, punching and similar, real time clocks, data screens, tape and disc stations, drums, etc). - Other equipment specific for EDP plants (data centre).

@value.label: Transformers
@value.definition: Equipment for electrical conversion, connected to the ship's main electrical distribution plant, including such as: High & Low Voltage Transformers.

811 Fire Detection, Fire and Lifeboat Alarm Systems

@value.label: Batteries and chargers
@value.definition: Equipment connected to the ship's main electrical distribution plant including such as: - Batteries with battery boxes, charging equipment, etc. common for more consumers, e.g. emergency light. (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 811 Fire Detection, Fire and Lifeboat Alarm Systems
813 Fire/Wash Down System, Emergency Fire Pumps, Sprinkler System
881 Cable Trays and Installation in Engine and Boiler Rooms

@value.label: Rectifiers and converters, ups
@value.definition: Equipment for electrical conversion, connected to the ship's main electrical distribution plant, including such as: - Rectifiers/converters for conversion of voltage, type of current and/or frequency. UPS Systems, such as, propulsion machinery, networks, etc.

@value.label: Electric shore supply systems
@value.definition: Electrical systems for supply to main distributors (switchboards mentioned in subgroup 871), including such as: - Cables between the switchboards, land  (shore) connections, including land connection locker and equipment placed out- side the MSB.
references: 881 Cable Trays and Installation in Engine and Boiler Rooms

@value.label: Unassigned
@value.definition: This code is unassigned and available for use.

@value.label: Common electrical distribution systems
@value.definition: The subgroups include, unless otherwise stated: - Production costs. - License and patent fees. - Purchases (materials and equipment). - Transport costs (external). - Installation and adjustment. - Testing and inspection (in workshops and during installation). Also included in the subgroups are: - MSB and ESB's, group starters, local starters and distribution panels/boards.
references: 65 DIESEL ENGINES FOR MAIN ELECTRIC POWER PRODUCTION
288 Internal Cathodic Protection and Antifouling System
278 External Cathodic Protection and Antifouling System
66 OTHER AGGREGATES FOR ELECTRIC POWER PRODUCTION

@value.label: Main switchboards
@value.definition: Main switchboards, including all installation work, as well as installed equipment, such as: - Rails, clamps, instruments, selectors, switches, (also generator circuit breakers and generator protection equipment), lights, name plates, etc., as well as manual magnetizing, synchronizing, phasing-in and load sharing equipment (Note! see also Ref.). If, in addition to the MSB, it is used a distribution switchboard which supplies consumers in more than one area, i.e. sup- plies machinery, etc. mentioned in more than one subgroup in group 89 (e.g. a 220 V distribution switchboard on upper deck from where electricity is distributed all over the ship), the distribution switchboard comes under this subgroup. The ship's motor starters and motor protection relays (overload relays, motor safety switches) placed in MSB, locally or in starter centrals, including lockers for starters, etc. (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 881 Cable Trays and Installation in Engine and Boiler Rooms
448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables

@value.label: Emergency switchboards
@value.definition: Emergency switchboards (ESB's), incl. all installation work, as well as installed equipment, such as: - Rails, clamps, instruments, selectors, switches, (also generator circuit breakers and generator protection equipment), lights, name plates, etc., as well as manual magnetizing, synchronizing, phasing-in and load sharing equipment (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 881 Cable Trays and Installation in Engine and Boiler Rooms
448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables

@value.label: Group starters group
@value.definition: Group starters, incl. all installation work, as well as installed equipment, such as: - Rails, clamps, instruments, selectors, switches, lights, name plates, etc., as well as manual magnetizing, synchronizing, phasing-in and load sharing equipment (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables

@value.label: Local starters group
@value.definition: Local starters, including all installation work, as well as installed equipment, such as: - Rails, clamps, instruments, selectors, switches, lights etc. - The ship's motor starters and motor protection relays (overload relays, motor safety switches) placed in MSB or on the motors follow the motors and the switchboards. (Note! see also Ref.).
references: 448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables

@value.label: Distribution panels and boards
@value.definition: Distribution panels and boards , including all installation work, as well as installed equipment, such as: - Rails, clamps, instruments, selectors, switches, lights etc.
references: 448 Nameplates/Marking on Machinery, Equipment, Pipes, Cables

@id: 881 Cable Trays and Installation in Engine and Boiler Rooms

@value.label: Cable trays and installation in engine and boiler rooms
@value.definition: Electrical cables and trays for machinery in engine room, boiler room and other adjoining rooms for machinery, such as: - Separator rooms. - Generator rooms (Note! see also Ref.). - Gear room. - Steering gear room. - Workshops and control rooms in/next to engine room, etc. The subgroup includes the following systems: - Electrical power supply systems, with cables, clamps and fittings (switches, junction boxes, fuse lockers, etc.) from the main distributors (switchboards mentioned in subgroup 881) directly and/or via sub-distribution switchboards (panels) for the area, including these (Note! see also Ref.), to machinery (pumps, compressors, fans, etc.) and also to automatic components in the mentioned rooms. - Electrical power supply systems, with cables, etc., to manoeuvring machinery; to steering gear, transverse propeller plant (side thrusters), stabilizing plant and brakes (for machinery in group 40). If small service leads (lines) - length and/or cross-section - are branched from the electrical systems in any of the men- tioned rooms, to other consumers (rooms), these leads are also to be entered here.
references: 883 Cable Trays and Installation on Deck and in Cargo Holds
882 Cable Trays with Installation in Accommodation
798 Cables/Leads and Piping for Automation Systems for Machinery

@id: 882 Cable Trays with Installation in Accommodation

@value.label: Cable trays with installation in accommodation
@value.definition: Electrical cables and trays for accommodation and external on superstructure (accommodation houses), in rooms/on places such as: - Cabins, messes and day rooms. - Wheelhouse and radio room. - Galley, laundry, etc. - Provision rooms and rooms for machinery for provisions. - Fan room (accommodation ventilation). - On superstructure/deck houses, external, (accommodation houses). The subgroup includes the following systems with supply cables from main distributors (switchboards mentioned in group 87) directly to consumers and/or to consumers via sub-distribution switchboards, including these (Note! see also Ref.): - Electrical power supply systems with cables, clamps and fittings (switches, junction boxes, fuse lockers, etc.) to machinery and equipment in the mentioned rooms (to machinery for provisions galley machinery, accommodation fans, navigation and communication systems, etc.) and at the mentioned places (for lifeboat winches, gangway winches, etc. on the superstructure). - Electrical lighting systems (main and emergency lights), with cables, clamps, pipes for cables, fittings, lamps, lighting fitting (armature) and receptacles in the mentioned rooms and external on superstructure, such as lamps above doors, searchlights, including these, on superstructure (Note! see also Ref.). - Electrical supply systems for lanterns and signal lights on superstructure are also included here (Note! see also Ref.). - Electrical heating systems with cables, etc., panel heaters, electric radiators, heating cables, heating lamps, etc., in the mentioned rooms. - Alarm system in connection with refrigerated rooms for provisions including alarms, cables, etc. If small service leads (lines) - length and/or cross- section - are branched from the electrical systems in the accom- modation, to other consumers (rooms), these leads are also to be entered here.
references: 427 Light and Signal Equipment, Lanterns, Typhoons
381 Sounding, Surveillance and Operating Equipment for Cargo Systems
883 Cable Trays and Installation on Deck and in Cargo Holds
417 Nautical Utility Equipment, Clockworks, Weather Facsimile

@id: 883 Cable Trays and Installation on Deck and in Cargo Holds

@value.label: Cable trays and installation on deck and in cargo holds
@value.definition: Electrical cables and trays for machinery (external) on upper deck or corresponding deck (main deck), in cargo holds and on adjoining decks and in rooms such as: - Forecastle deck and in rooms below forecastle deck (Note! see also Ref.). - Small deck houses (winch houses, pump houses, control rooms, fan houses, etc.). - Special rooms for machinery for cargo, for such as cargo freezing/refrigerating systems, cargo ventilation systems, load- ing/discharging pumps etc.

@id: 891 Electric Lighting Systems for Engine and Boiler Room

@value.label: Electric lighting systems for engine and boiler room
@value.definition: Electrical lighting systems for engine room, boiler rooms, and other adjoining rooms for machinery, such as: - Separator rooms. - Generator rooms. - Gear room, shaft tunnel. - Workshops and control rooms in/next to engine room, etc. - Steering gear room. The subgroup includes the following systems: - Electrical lighting systems (main and emergency lights) with cables, clamps and fittings (switches, junction boxes, fuse lockers, etc.) from sub-distribution switchboards (panels) for the area and including these (Note! see also Ref.), or from MSB to lamps, light fitting (armature) and receptacles, including these, in the mentioned rooms. - Electrical heating systems with cables, clamps and fittings from sub-distribution switchboards (panels) for the area, incl. these, or from MSB to panel heaters, electric radiators, heating cables, heating lamps, etc., including these, in the mentioned rooms. If small service leads (lines) - length and/or cross section - are branched from the electrical systems in any of the men- tioned rooms, to other consumers (rooms), these leads are also to be entered here.

@value.label: Electric lighting systems for accommodation
@value.definition: Electrical lighting systems for accommodation and external on superstructure (accommodation houses), in rooms/on places such as: - Cabins, messes and day rooms. - Wheelhouse and radio room. - Galley, laundry, etc. - Provision rooms and rooms for machinery for provisions. - Fan room (accommodation ventilation). - On superstructure/deck houses, external, (accommodation houses). The subgroup includes the following systems with supply from main and local distributors (switchboards mentioned in group 87) directly to consumers and/or to consumers via sub-distribution switchboards, including these (Note! see also Ref.): - Electrical lighting systems (main and emergency lights), with cables, clamps, pipes for cables, fittings, lamps, lighting fitting (armature)  and receptacles in the mentioned rooms and external on superstructure, such as lamps above doors, searchlights, including these, on super-structure (Note! see also Ref.). - Electrical heating systems with cables, etc., panel heaters, electric radiators, heating cables, heating lamps, etc., in the mentioned rooms. - Alarm system in connection with refrigerated rooms for provisions including alarms, cables, etc. If small service leads (lines) - length and/or cross- section - are branched from the electrical systems in the accom- modation, to other consumers (rooms), these leads are also to be entered here.
references: 427 Light and Signal Equipment, Lanterns, Typhoons

@id: 893 Electric Lighting Systems for Deck and Cargo Holds

@value.label: Electric lighting systems for deck and cargo holds
@value.definition: Electrical lighting systems for cargo hold/weather deck or corresponding deck (main deck) also car deck, and adjoining decks and rooms, such as: - Forecastle deck and rooms below forecastle. - Small deck houses (winch houses, pump houses, fan houses, etc.). - Special rooms for machinery for cargo, for such as cargo freezing/refrigerating system, cargo ventilation system, load- ing/discharging pumps, etc., as well as cofferdams. - After deck as well as deck below after deck in ships with engine room placed amidships. The subgroup includes the following systems: (Note! see also Ref.): - Electrical lighting systems (main and emergency lights) with cables, clamps and fittings (switches, junction boxes, fuse boxes, etc.), lamps, searchlights for decks, mounted in masts, including control equipment and arrangement for remote control, light fittings and possible receptacles on the mentioned places. - Electrical heating systems with cables, etc., panel heaters, electric radiators, heating cables, heating lamps, etc., in the mentioned rooms. If small service leads (lines) - length and or cross-section - are branched from the electrical systems on the mentioned places, to other consumers (e.g. to light points in/beside hatch openings), these leads are also to be entered here.
references: 427 Light and Signal Equipment, Lanterns, Typhoons
